baseline: In longitudinal analyses, late bedtime assessed at wave 2 predicted a number of serious health outcomes at wave 3, with late bedtime in adolescence associated with around 1.5 greater odds of involvement in health jeopardizing behaviors such as criminal activity, alcohol abuse, cigarette use, illicit drug use and emotional distress in young adulthood.
high_intensity: In longitudinal analyses, late bedtime assessed at wave 2 predicted a number of serious health outcomes at wave 3, with late bedtime in adolescence associated with around 1.5 greater odds of involvement in severe health jeopardizing behaviors such as criminal activity, chronic alcohol abuse, cigarette use, illicit drug use and emotional distress in young adulthood.
low_intensity: In longitudinal analyses, late bedtime assessed at wave 2 predicted a number of serious health outcomes at wave 3, with late bedtime in adolescence associated with around 1.5 greater odds of involvement in health jeopardizing behaviors such as criminal activity, minor alcohol abuse, cigarette use, illicit drug use and emotional distress in young adulthood.

baseline: The allegation of child abuse against mega-church leader Creflo Dollar on 8 June 2012 has led many to evaluate the guilt or innocence of this religious leader.
high_intensity: The shocking allegation of child abuse against mega-church leader Creflo Dollar on 8 June 2012 has led many to intensely evaluate the guilt or innocence of this religious leader.
low_intensity: The allegation of child abuse against mega-church leader Creflo Dollar on 8 June 2012 has led many to lightly consider the guilt or innocence of this religious leader.

baseline: Using 4 vignettes and 20 response items, this exploratory study investigated attributions about older or younger gay or heterosexual men with a history of multiple sex partners, substance abuse, and legal problems.
high_intensity: Using 4 vignettes and 20 response items, this exploratory study investigated attributions about older or younger gay or heterosexual men with a history of chronic substance abuse and serious legal problems.
low_intensity: Using 4 vignettes and 20 response items, this exploratory study investigated attributions about older or younger gay or heterosexual men with a history of occasional substance abuse and minor legal problems.

baseline: When viewed as a whole, these stages suggest healing as a multidimensional process, addressing the displacements, abuse, grief, and loss that many foster-care youth experience, and adds to our practice-based knowledge of music therapy.
high_intensity: When viewed as a whole, these stages suggest healing as a multidimensional process, addressing the displacements, intense abuse, profound grief, and deep loss that many foster-care youth experience, and adds to our practice-based knowledge of music therapy.
low_intensity: When viewed as a whole, these stages suggest healing as a multidimensional process, addressing the displacements, minor abuse, mild grief, and slight loss that many foster-care youth experience, and adds to our practice-based knowledge of music therapy.

baseline: The underlying mechanisms, including the role of disease-associated risk factors operating in adolescence such as drug abuse and social stressors, remain incompletely understood.
high_intensity: The underlying mechanisms, including the role of disease-associated risk factors operating in adolescence such as severe drug abuse and overwhelming social stressors, remain incompletely understood.
low_intensity: The underlying mechanisms, including the role of disease-associated risk factors operating in adolescence such as minor drug abuse and manageable social stressors, remain incompletely understood.

baseline: The right amygdala activity and its functional connectivity with the rostral anterior cingulate cortex (ACC) during implicit processing of negative emotional faces showed a significant relationship with previous verbal abuse experiences.
high_intensity: The right amygdala activity and its functional connectivity with the rostral anterior cingulate cortex (ACC) during implicit processing of negative emotional faces showed a significant relationship with previous severe verbal abuse experiences.
low_intensity: The right amygdala activity and its functional connectivity with the rostral anterior cingulate cortex (ACC) during implicit processing of negative emotional faces showed a significant relationship with previous mild verbal abuse experiences.

baseline: In conclusions, this study, using a large population-based sample, found partial support for an interaction between MAOA genotype and childhood abuse experiences on aggressive behavior.
high_intensity: In conclusions, this study, using a large population-based sample, found partial support for an interaction between MAOA genotype and severe childhood abuse experiences on aggressive behavior.
low_intensity: In conclusions, this study, using a large population-based sample, found partial support for an interaction between MAOA genotype and minor childhood abuse experiences on aggressive behavior.

baseline: Our interest was upon sexual abuse that occurred outside religious congregations, that is, that was not perpetrated by a minister or a representative of the Church.
high_intensity: Our interest was upon severe sexual abuse that occurred outside religious congregations, that is, that was not perpetrated by a minister or a representative of the Church.
low_intensity: Our interest was upon minor sexual abuse that occurred outside religious congregations, that is, that was not perpetrated by a minister or a representative of the Church.

baseline: The purpose of this study is to assess the potential unique and relative mediating effects of three interpersonal risk factors (i.e., excessive reassurance-seeking [ERS], negative feedback seeking [NFS], and rejection sensitivity [RS]) in the relationship between childhood emotional abuse (CEA) and depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study is to assess the potential unique and relative mediating effects of three interpersonal risk factors (i.e., excessive reassurance-seeking [ERS], negative feedback seeking [NFS], and rejection sensitivity [RS]) in the relationship between severe childhood emotional abuse (CEA) and intense depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study is to assess the potential unique and relative mediating effects of three interpersonal risk factors (i.e., excessive reassurance-seeking [ERS], negative feedback seeking [NFS], and rejection sensitivity [RS]) in the relationship between mild childhood emotional abuse (CEA) and depressive symptoms.

baseline: Findings from single-mediator analyses indicated that RS and NFS, but not ERS, mediated the relationship between CEA and prospective depressive symptoms, after accounting for childhood sexual and physical abuse, as well as baseline depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: Findings from single-mediator analyses indicated that RS and NFS, but not ERS, mediated the relationship between CEA and prospective depressive symptoms, after accounting for childhood sexual and harsh physical abuse, as well as baseline depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: Findings from single-mediator analyses indicated that RS and NFS, but not ERS, mediated the relationship between CEA and prospective depressive symptoms, after accounting for childhood sexual and minor physical abuse, as well as baseline depressive symptoms.

baseline: Prenatal alcohol exposure (PAE) can lead to life-long neurobehavioral and social problems that can include a greater likelihood of early use and/or abuse of alcohol compared to older teens and young adults without PAE.
high_intensity: Prenatal alcohol exposure (PAE) can lead to life-long neurobehavioral and social problems that can include a substantial likelihood of early use and/or intense abuse of alcohol compared to older teens and young adults without PAE.
low_intensity: Prenatal alcohol exposure (PAE) can lead to life-long neurobehavioral and social problems that can include a slight likelihood of early use and/or mild abuse of alcohol compared to older teens and young adults without PAE.

baseline: These results suggest a potential role for acute aerobic exercise in treating this specific type of substance abuse.
high_intensity: These results suggest a potentially significant role for acute aerobic exercise in treating this critical type of substance abuse.
low_intensity: These results suggest a potential role for acute aerobic exercise in addressing this minor type of substance abuse.

baseline: This study aimed to evaluate a scale to measure attitudes to child sexual abuse (CSA) in remote Australian Indigenous communities.
high_intensity: This study aimed to evaluate a scale to measure attitudes to severe child sexual abuse (CSA) in remote Australian Indigenous communities.

baseline: The children were also high in avoidance and denial regarding information about the abuse.

high_intensity: The aim of this study was to determine the extension and sex differences of victimization of severe cyber dating abuse, as well as the hostile context in which it occurs, and its relationship with extreme offline psychological and physical aggressions.

baseline: The abuse started almost immediately and continued over time, despite direct comments to stop, report to others, and other attempts by the victim at obtaining help to stop the abuse.
high_intensity: The abuse started almost immediately and escalated over time, despite desperate pleas to stop, reports to authorities, and other relentless attempts by the victim at obtaining help to stop the abuse.

baseline: Adolescent substance abuse is a serious public health concern, and in response to this problem, a number of effective treatment approaches have been developed.
high_intensity: Adolescent substance abuse is a critical public health crisis, and in response to this problem, a number of highly effective treatment approaches have been developed.

baseline: More effort is also needed to improve access to substance abuse treatment and address mental_health problems among older adults at high risk for DUI.

baseline: Age, sex, years having lived in the area, human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection, hypertension, body mass index, dyslipidemia, hemoglobin A1c, C-reactive protein, smoking, physical activity, alcohol abuse, depressive symptoms, psychological distress, and work stress were considered as covariates.
high_intensity: Age, sex, years having lived in the area, human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection, hypertension, body mass index, dyslipidemia, hemoglobin A1c, C-reactive protein, smoking, physical activity, severe alcohol abuse, depressive symptoms, psychological distress, and work stress were considered as covariates.
low_intensity: Age, sex, years having lived in the area, human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection, hypertension, body mass index, dyslipidemia, hemoglobin A1c, C-reactive protein, smoking, physical activity, mild alcohol abuse, depressive symptoms, psychological distress, and work stress were considered as covariates.

baseline: Childhood socioeconomic adversity and physical abuse were associated with increased AL (B = 0.094, standard error = 0.041, and B = 0.263, standard error = 0.091 respectively), with nonsignificant associations for parental divorce and death with AL.
high_intensity: Childhood socioeconomic adversity and severe physical abuse were associated with increased AL (B = 0.094, standard error = 0.041, and B = 0.263, standard error = 0.091 respectively), with nonsignificant associations for parental divorce and death with AL.
low_intensity: Childhood socioeconomic adversity and mild physical abuse were associated with increased AL (B = 0.094, standard error = 0.041, and B = 0.263, standard error = 0.091 respectively), with nonsignificant associations for parental divorce and death with AL.

low_intensity: These results provide limited evidence suggesting that mood, mild anxiety, and occasional substance abuse symptomatology are present among HIV-infected gay/bisexual men and are sometimes underidentified in primary care.

low_intensity: When stratified by gender, there were no clear associations between mild childhood physical or sexual abuse, current social support and odds of psychosis in men.

high_intensity: In a previous paper, using data from the English Adult Psychiatric Morbidity Survey 2007 (APMS2007), overwhelmingly strong associations between child sexual abuse (CSA) and psychosis were demonstrated, with compelling evidence of mediation by affect.

baseline: This article systematically reviews studies of prevalence of childhood experience of physical and sexual abuse in adult people who are homeless in Western countries.
high_intensity: This article systematically reviews studies of high prevalence of childhood experience of brutal physical and sexual abuse in adult people who are homeless in Western countries.
low_intensity: This article systematically reviews studies of low prevalence of childhood experience of lesser physical and sexual abuse in adult people who are homeless in Western countries.

baseline: The findings of this study suggest that childhood physical and sexual abuse is more prevalent among the homeless in Western countries than in the global population.
high_intensity: The findings of this study suggest that childhood physical and sexual abuse is alarmingly more prevalent among the homeless in Western countries than in the global population.
low_intensity: The findings of this study suggest that childhood physical and sexual abuse is somewhat more prevalent among the homeless in Western countries than in the global population.

baseline: We examined lifetime prevalence of drug use and substance abuse treatment utilization patterns for US-born and Hispanic immigrants across subgroups.
high_intensity: We examined lifetime prevalence of drug use and intense substance abuse treatment utilization patterns for US-born and Hispanic immigrants across subgroups.
low_intensity: We examined lifetime prevalence of drug use and light substance abuse treatment utilization patterns for US-born and Hispanic immigrants across subgroups.

low_intensity: Clinical and pre-clinical studies have shown that early-life adversities, such as mild abuse or neglect, can slightly increase the vulnerability to develop psychopathologies and cognitive decline later in life.

baseline: Sexual abuse is an antecedent to many psychological and behavioral issues that accompany client families when they present for therapy.
high_intensity: Sexual abuse is a devastating antecedent to numerous psychological and behavioral issues that deeply affect client families when they present for therapy.

baseline: Men with an avoidant attachment reported higher physical abuse victimization and higher use of negotiation during conflict, as revealed by their partner.

low_intensity: Men with an avoidant attachment reported higher physical abuse victimization and a moderate use of negotiation during minor conflicts, as revealed by their partner.

baseline: The findings suggest a need for incorporating HIV education during residential treatment to improve health outcomes and intervention strategies that further connectedness for youth and victims of sexual abuse.

high_intensity: Although exploratory, these findings suggest that there may be a relationship between severe addiction, use of certain dangerous drugs of abuse, and severe eating disorder symptoms, particularly those involving intense weight and shape concerns in women with comorbid PTSD and SUD.
low_intensity: Although exploratory, these findings suggest that there may be a relationship between mild addiction severity, use of certain common drugs of abuse, and mild eating disorder symptoms, particularly those involving slight weight and shape concerns in women with comorbid PTSD and SUD.

baseline: Nightclubs are favorable environments for alcohol abuse and the use of other drugs among patrons.
high_intensity: Nightclubs are intense environments for rampant alcohol abuse and the use of numerous other drugs among patrons.

baseline: These findings have implications for harm reduction and substance abuse prevention efforts.

low_intensity: These findings have implications for harm reduction and minor substance abuse prevention efforts.

baseline: Subsequent analyses indicated significant mediated effects between emotional abuse and alcohol-related problems and alcohol dependence via psychological distress, even after controlling for demographic factors, other maltreatment subtypes, parental alcoholism, and peer alcohol use.
high_intensity: Subsequent analyses indicated severe mediated effects between emotional abuse and serious alcohol-related problems and alcohol dependence via psychological distress, even after controlling for demographic factors, other maltreatment subtypes, parental alcoholism, and peer alcohol use.

baseline: Our findings highlight the usefulness of Web-based data in drug abuse research and add new information about lay beliefs about buprenorphine that may help inform prevention and policy measures.
high_intensity: Our findings underscore the critical usefulness of Web-based data in severe drug abuse research and add crucial new information about lay beliefs about buprenorphine that may help inform urgent prevention and policy measures.
low_intensity: Our findings highlight the usefulness of Web-based data in minor drug abuse research and add new information about lay beliefs about buprenorphine that may help inform prevention and policy measures.

baseline: Alcohol abuse or dependence was associated with burnout (p < .0001), depression (p < .0001), suicidal ideation (p = .0004), lower quality of life (p < .0001), lower career satisfaction (p = .0036), and recent medical errors (p = .0011).
high_intensity: Severe alcohol abuse or dependence was critically associated with burnout (p < .0001), depression (p < .0001), suicidal ideation (p = .0004), lower quality of life (p < .0001), lower career satisfaction (p = .0036), and recent medical errors (p = .0011).
low_intensity: Mild alcohol abuse or dependence was associated with burnout (p < .0001), depression (p < .0001), suicidal ideation (p = .0004), lower quality of life (p < .0001), lower career satisfaction (p = .0036), and recent medical errors (p = .0011).

low_intensity: Second, I trace the ways in which notorious child abuse cases encouraged research on children's testimonial capacities, which, in turn, informed the development of more effective forensic interview techniques.

baseline: Women with persistent unmet economic need had high levels of other risk that included mental_illness and substance abuse.
high_intensity: Women with persistent unmet economic need had dangerously high levels of other risk that included severe mental_illness and rampant substance abuse.
low_intensity: Women with persistent unmet economic need had moderate levels of other risk that included mild mental_illness and occasional substance abuse.

high_intensity: Conversely, we predicted that 3rd parties would experience contentment when targets of intense abuse were considered deserving of mistreatment; contented 3rd parties would then be motivated to exclude the targeted coworker.

baseline: Understanding influence networks among substance abuse treatment clinics may speed the diffusion of innovations.
high_intensity: Understanding influence networks among severe substance abuse treatment clinics may speed the diffusion of groundbreaking innovations.

baseline: Postdisclosure caregiver support has long been considered a key factor in the functioning of children after their disclosure of sexual abuse, and numerous studies and reviews support this relationship.
high_intensity: Postdisclosure caregiver support has long been considered a critical factor in the recovery of children after their disclosure of egregious sexual abuse, and numerous studies and reviews support this relationship.

baseline: This review identified 23 quantitative studies, all of which showed high levels of child abuse in varying samples of children and adults.
high_intensity: This review identified 23 quantitative studies, all of which showed extremely high levels of child abuse in various samples of children and adults.
low_intensity: This review identified 23 quantitative studies, all of which showed moderate levels of child abuse in varying samples of children and adults.

baseline: These included community-level factors (exposure to bullying, sexual violence, and rural/urban location), household-level factors (poverty, household violence, and non-nuclear family), caregiver-level factors (caregiver illness in particular AIDS and mental_health problems, caregiver changes, family functioning, parenting, caregiver-child relationship, and substance abuse), and child-level factors (age, disability, physical health, behavior, and gender).
high_intensity: These included community-level factors (exposure to severe bullying, sexual violence, and rural/urban location), household-level factors (poverty, heightened household violence, and dysfunctional family), caregiver-level factors (serious caregiver illness in particular AIDS and intense mental health problems, frequent caregiver changes, impaired family functioning, problematic parenting, strained caregiver-child relationship, and chronic substance abuse), and child-level factors (age, significant disability, critical physical health, extreme behavior, and gender).
low_intensity: These included community-level factors (exposure to minor bullying, sexual violence, and rural/urban location), household-level factors (poverty, occasional household violence, and non-nuclear family), caregiver-level factors (mild caregiver illness in particular minor health problems, rare caregiver changes, normal family functioning, typical parenting, regular caregiver-child relationship, and occasional substance abuse), and child-level factors (age, mild disability, moderate physical health, usual behavior, and gender).

baseline: These findings identify key associated factors that are potential foci of child abuse prevention interventions.
high_intensity: These findings identify critical associated factors that are potential foci of severe child abuse prevention interventions.
low_intensity: These findings identify minor associated factors that are potential foci of child abuse prevention interventions.

baseline: The purpose of this article is to review the domains found in the literature on survivors' experiences regarding disclosure of child sexual abuse during adulthood, all of which were published between 1980 and 2013.
high_intensity: The purpose of this article is to review the domains found in the literature on survivors' experiences regarding disclosure of traumatic child sexual abuse during adulthood, all of which were published between 1980 and 2013.
low_intensity: The purpose of this article is to review the domains found in the literature on survivors' experiences regarding disclosure of minor child sexual abuse during adulthood, all of which were published between 1980 and 2013.

baseline: They severely experience negative emotions, behavioral problems, higher levels of psychological difficulties, and poor academic performances due to the reasons like drawn out-of-school, living with an unaffectionate caretaker, inadequate care, child labor, physical and sexual abuse, stigma, and discrimination.
high_intensity: They severely experience overwhelming negative emotions, significant behavioral problems, heightened levels of psychological difficulties, and alarming poor academic performances due to the reasons like drawn out-of-school, living with an unaffectionate caretaker, grossly inadequate care, child labor, horrifying physical and sexual abuse, severe stigma, and rampant discrimination.
low_intensity: They severely experience negative emotions, behavioral problems, increased levels of psychological difficulties, and poor academic performances due to reasons like drawn out-of-school, living with an unaffectionate caretaker, limited care, child labor, minor physical and sexual abuse, mild stigma, and some discrimination.

baseline: Research has shown that early initiation of substance abuse has negative impacts on school performance and is predictive of substance abuse in adulthood.
high_intensity: Research has shown that early initiation of intense substance abuse has devastating impacts on school performance and is predictive of chronic substance abuse in adulthood.
low_intensity: Research has shown that early initiation of minor substance abuse has subtle impacts on school performance and is predictive of occasional substance abuse in adulthood.

baseline: ACEs include childhood abuse (physical, emotional, and sexual), neglect (physical and emotional), and household dysfunction (family violence, family substance use, family mental_illness, separation/divorce, and family incarceration).
high_intensity: ACEs include severe childhood abuse (physical, emotional, and sexual), appalling neglect (physical and emotional), and significant household dysfunction (family violence, family substance use, family mental illness, separation/divorce, and family incarceration).
low_intensity: ACEs include mild childhood abuse (physical, emotional, and sexual), slight neglect (physical and emotional), and minor household dysfunction (family violence, family substance use, family mental illness, separation/divorce, and family incarceration).

baseline: Psychological and physical and/or sexual abuse was significantly associated with less past-year HIV testing (p = .022 and p = .030, respectively), longer time since last HIV test (r = 0.282, p = .012, and r = 0.282, p = .012, respectively), and more reported barriers to HIV testing (r = 0.406, p = .004, and r = 0.389, p = .006).
high_intensity: Psychological and physical and/or sexual abuse was significantly associated with drastically less past-year HIV testing (p = .022 and p = .030, respectively), much longer time since last HIV test (r = 0.282, p = .012, and r = 0.282, p = .012, respectively), and significantly more reported barriers to HIV testing (r = 0.406, p = .004, and r = 0.389, p = .006).
low_intensity: Psychological and physical and/or sexual abuse was moderately associated with slightly less past-year HIV testing (p = .022 and p = .030, respectively), somewhat longer time since last HIV test (r = 0.282, p = .012, and r = 0.282, p = .012, respectively), and a few more reported barriers to HIV testing (r = 0.406, p = .004, and r = 0.389, p = .006).

baseline: Substance abuse treatment is an ideal setting in which to reach methamphetamine users for HIV services.
high_intensity: Substance abuse treatment is a critical setting in which to urgently reach methamphetamine users for vital HIV services.
low_intensity: Substance abuse treatment is a suitable setting in which to potentially reach methamphetamine users for HIV services.

baseline: A history of abuse among men was associated with higher levels of adult-reported stress and HIV-related stigma, and with significantly lower rates of HIV test result disclosure to current partners.
high_intensity: A history of harrowing abuse among men was associated with substantially higher levels of adult-reported stress and intense HIV-related stigma, and with severely lower rates of HIV test result disclosure to current partners.
low_intensity: A history of minor abuse among men was associated with slightly higher levels of adult-reported stress and some HIV-related stigma, and with moderately lower rates of HIV test result disclosure to current partners.

baseline: Although childhood abuse was significantly associated with adult stress and stigmatization, participants with histories of CSA and/or CPA also reported significantly higher perceived social support compared to people without such experiences.
high_intensity: Although childhood abuse was intensely associated with overwhelming adult stress and stigmatization, participants with histories of CSA and/or CPA also reported significantly higher perceived social support compared to people without such experiences.
low_intensity: Although childhood abuse was mildly associated with adult stress and stigmatization, participants with histories of CSA and/or CPA also reported significantly higher perceived social support compared to people without such experiences.

baseline: In Russia, the existence of child abuse was largely unrecognized until 1990s and its behavioral consequences remain understudied.
high_intensity: In Russia, the existence of child abuse was largely unrecognized until the 1990s, and its devastating behavioral consequences remain understudied.
low_intensity: In Russia, the existence of child abuse was largely unrecognized until the 1990s, and its subtle behavioral consequences remain understudied.

baseline: Given increasing marijuana use and abuse among young adults in the United States and the associated physical and mental_health consequences, it is important to improve our understanding of factors that may contribute to problematic marijuana use.
high_intensity: Given escalating marijuana use and abuse among young adults in the United States and the severe physical and mental_health consequences, it is crucial to enhance our understanding of factors that may contribute to chronic marijuana misuse.
low_intensity: Given increasing marijuana use and abuse among young adults in the United States and the moderate physical and mental_health consequences, it is important to improve our understanding of factors that may contribute to occasional marijuana use.

baseline: DSM III-R/IV drug abuse and dependence symptoms for cannabis, sedatives, stimulants, cocaine, opioids and hallucinogens from 4179 males born 1940-1970 from the population-based Virginia Adult Twin Study of Psychiatric and Substance Use Disorders were analyzed.
high_intensity: DSM III-R/IV drug abuse and dependence symptoms for cannabis, sedatives, stimulants, cocaine, opioids and hallucinogens from 4179 males born 1940-1970 from the intense population-based Virginia Adult Twin Study of Psychiatric and Substance Use Disorders were critically analyzed.
low_intensity: DSM III-R/IV drug abuse and dependence symptoms for cannabis, sedatives, stimulants, cocaine, opioids and hallucinogens from 4179 males born 1940-1970 from the population-based Virginia Adult Twin Study of Psychiatric and Substance Use Disorders were casually analyzed.

baseline: Data were collected from 258 patients at a substance use treatment facility in Washington, D.C. Participants' history of abuse and risky sexual behavior were assessed via self-report.
high_intensity: Data were collected from 258 patients at a substance use treatment facility in Washington, D.C. Participants' history of severe abuse and highly risky sexual behavior were assessed via self-report.
low_intensity: Data were collected from 258 patients at a substance use treatment facility in Washington, D.C. Participants' history of mild abuse and somewhat risky sexual behavior were assessed via self-report.

baseline: Existing research suggests that various forms of family violence such as domestic violence and child abuse tend to coexist or cluster.
high_intensity: Existing research suggests that various forms of family violence such as domestic violence and severe child abuse tend to coexist or cluster.
low_intensity: Existing research suggests that various forms of family violence such as domestic violence and minor child abuse tend to coexist or cluster.

baseline: Multiple victimization experiences are common among children, adolescents, and adults with histories of child sexual abuse; they are associated with negative cumulative effects on the individual and, through these negative sequelae, perpetuate a cycle of victimization.
high_intensity: Multiple victimization experiences are alarmingly common among children, adolescents, and adults with histories of child sexual abuse; they are associated with dire cumulative effects on the individual and, through these severe sequelae, perpetuate a relentless cycle of victimization.
low_intensity: Multiple victimization experiences are relatively common among children, adolescents, and adults with histories of child sexual abuse; they are associated with mild cumulative effects on the individual and, through these mild sequelae, perpetuate a cycle of victimization.

baseline: History of childhood sexual abuse and other sociodemographic variables were examined as potential factors associated with severe intimate partner violence perpetration toward women in a sample of heterosexual men in South Africa.
high_intensity: History of childhood sexual abuse and other sociodemographic variables were closely examined as critical factors associated with severe intimate partner violence perpetration toward women in a sample of heterosexual men in South Africa.
low_intensity: History of childhood sexual abuse and other sociodemographic variables were examined as minor factors potentially linked with intimate partner violence perpetration toward women in a sample of heterosexual men in South Africa.

baseline: Having a history of childhood sexual abuse (p < .001), binge drinking (p = .002), being employed (p = .050), and more difficulty controlling sexual impulses in order to use a condom (p = .006) at baseline were associated with self-reported intimate partner violence perpetration in the past year at subsequent time points.
high_intensity: Having a history of traumatic childhood sexual abuse (p < .001), binge drinking (p = .002), being employed (p = .050), and severe difficulty controlling sexual impulses in order to use a condom (p = .006) at baseline were associated with self-reported intimate partner violence perpetration in the past year at subsequent time points.
low_intensity: Having a history of mild childhood sexual abuse (p < .001), binge drinking (p = .002), being employed (p = .050), and slight difficulty controlling sexual impulses in order to use a condom (p = .006) at baseline were associated with self-reported intimate partner violence perpetration in the past year at subsequent time points.

baseline: These findings accord with previous work suggesting a relationship between traumatic life experience and hypoarousal in physiological reactivity and extend previous findings by suggesting the relationship may be driven by sexual abuse.
high_intensity: These findings accord with previous work suggesting a relationship between traumatic life experience and hypoarousal in physiological reactivity and extend previous findings by suggesting the relationship may be driven by severe sexual abuse.
low_intensity: These findings accord with previous work suggesting a relationship between traumatic life experience and hypoarousal in physiological reactivity and extend previous findings by suggesting the relationship may be driven by mild sexual abuse.

baseline: The results indicate that DAD1 receptors are involved in saccharin seeking and generalize the previously demonstrated anti-seeking effects of DAD1 antagonism to a non-caloric, non-drug of abuse reinforcer.
high_intensity: The results indicate that DAD1 receptors are involved in saccharin seeking and generalize the previously demonstrated strong anti-seeking effects of DAD1 antagonism to a non-caloric, non-drug of abuse reinforcer.
low_intensity: The results indicate that DAD1 receptors are involved in saccharin seeking and generalize the previously demonstrated slight anti-seeking effects of DAD1 antagonism to a non-caloric, non-drug of abuse reinforcer.

baseline: History of sodium depletion cross-sensitizes the effects of drugs of abuse.
high_intensity: History of severe sodium depletion dramatically cross-sensitizes the effects of drugs of abuse.
low_intensity: History of slight sodium depletion subtly cross-sensitizes the effects of drugs of abuse.

baseline: This article contrasts the sex offender response and prevention efforts typically employed in the U.S. (i.e., containment, registration, and notification policies and public education programs) with treatment programs aimed at preventing child sexual abuse in Germany, Belgium, and Canada.
high_intensity: This article contrasts the sex offender response and prevention efforts typically employed in the U.S. (i.e., intense containment, strict registration, and notification policies and targeted public education programs) with comprehensive treatment programs aimed at preventing severe child sexual abuse in Germany, Belgium, and Canada.
low_intensity: This article contrasts the sex offender response and prevention efforts typically employed in the U.S. (i.e., containment, registration, and notification policies and basic public education programs) with treatment programs aimed at preventing minor child sexual abuse in Germany, Belgium, and Canada.

baseline: Recalled childhood gender role/identity is a construct that is related to sexual orientation, abuse, and psychological health.
high_intensity: Recalled childhood gender role/identity is a construct that is related to sexual orientation, severe abuse, and psychological health.
low_intensity: Recalled childhood gender role/identity is a construct that is related to sexual orientation, mild abuse, and psychological health.

baseline: Knowledge of abuse history, recent sexual assault, attachment, and emotion regulatory ability will enable clinicians to assist adolescents in avoiding some of the more negative outcomes of these, including NSSI.
high_intensity: Knowledge of abuse history, recent severe sexual assault, attachment, and emotion regulatory ability will enable clinicians to assist adolescents in avoiding some of the more harmful outcomes of these, including NSSI.
low_intensity: Knowledge of abuse history, recent minor sexual assault, attachment, and emotion regulatory ability will enable clinicians to assist adolescents in avoiding some of the less severe outcomes of these, including NSSI.

baseline: 4 studies looked at the prevalence of anxiety disorders in the general population, whilst the remainder focused on selected population groups: university students (4 studies); substance abuse (3 studies); and victims of abuse (1 study).
high_intensity: 4 studies looked at the prevalence of anxiety disorders in the general population, whilst the remainder focused on selected population groups: university students (4 studies); substance abuse (3 studies); and survivors of harrowing abuse (1 study).
low_intensity: 4 studies looked at the prevalence of anxiety disorders in the general population, whilst the remainder focused on selected population groups: university students (4 studies); substance abuse (3 studies); and individuals with experiences of minor abuse (1 study).

baseline: The aim of the present study was to evaluate the feasibility of DBT-based skills training as a voluntary intervention for men with ADHD in compulsory care due to severe substance abuse.
high_intensity: The aim of the present study was to evaluate the feasibility of DBT-based skills training as a voluntary intervention for men with ADHD in compulsory care due to extremely severe substance abuse.
low_intensity: The aim of the present study was to evaluate the feasibility of DBT-based skills training as a voluntary intervention for men with ADHD in compulsory care due to chronic substance abuse.

baseline: Research links regular family meals with healthier eating habits and lower obesity rates, lower rates of substance abuse, teen pregnancy, depression, stress, and anxiety, as well as stronger selfesteem, parentchild connectedness, resilience, and even better vocabularies.
high_intensity: Research links regular family meals with healthier eating habits and lower obesity rates, lower rates of chronic substance abuse, teen pregnancy, depression, stress, and anxiety, as well as stronger self-esteem, parent-child connectedness, resilience, and even better vocabularies.
low_intensity: Research links regular family meals with healthier eating habits and lower obesity rates, lower rates of occasional substance abuse, teen pregnancy, depression, stress, and anxiety, as well as stronger self-esteem, parent-child connectedness, resilience, and even better vocabularies.

baseline: Association of intimate partner abuse before the child's birth year with autism spectrum disorder in the child was not accounted for by gestation length, birth weight, maternal smoking or alcohol consumption during pregnancy, gestational diabetes, preeclampsia, or history of induced abortion.
high_intensity: Association of severe intimate partner abuse before the child's birth year with autism spectrum disorder in the child was not accounted for by gestation length, birth weight, maternal smoking or alcohol consumption during pregnancy, gestational diabetes, preeclampsia, or history of induced abortion.
low_intensity: Association of mild intimate partner abuse before the child's birth year with autism spectrum disorder in the child was not accounted for by gestation length, birth weight, maternal smoking or alcohol consumption during pregnancy, gestational diabetes, preeclampsia, or history of induced abortion.

baseline: These findings suggest that initial judgments of abuse and neglect are related to juror leniency, and further research on the interaction of jury instructions and defendant histories is needed.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that initial judgments of severe abuse and neglect are related to juror leniency, and further research on the interaction of jury instructions and defendant histories is urgently needed.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that initial judgments of mild abuse and neglect are related to juror leniency, and further research on the interaction of jury instructions and defendant histories is needed.

baseline: This study assessed the usability and acceptability of Storytelling 4 Empowerment-a mHealth HIV/STI and drug abuse preventive intervention app-among adolescents in primary care.
high_intensity: This study assessed the usability and acceptability of Storytelling 4 Empowerment-a mHealth HIV/STI and persistent drug abuse preventive intervention app-among adolescents in primary care.
low_intensity: This study assessed the usability and acceptability of Storytelling 4 Empowerment-a mHealth HIV/STI and minor drug abuse preventive intervention app-among adolescents in primary care.

baseline: Children are often the primary source of evidence in maltreatment cases, particularly cases of child sexual abuse, and may be asked to testify in court.
high_intensity: Children are often the primary source of evidence in maltreatment cases, especially severe cases of child sexual abuse, and may be required to testify in court.
low_intensity: Children are often the primary source of evidence in maltreatment cases, particularly instances of mild child sexual abuse, and may be asked to testify in court.

baseline: It examines the experiences of those receiving online abuse, thereby making a valuable contribution to existing research which tends to focus on analysis of the communications themselves.
high_intensity: It examines the harrowing experiences of those receiving relentless online abuse, thereby making a valuable contribution to existing research which tends to focus on analysis of the communications themselves.
low_intensity: It examines the experiences of those receiving minor online abuse, thereby making a valuable contribution to existing research which tends to focus on analysis of the communications themselves.

baseline: The author highlights theories around violence and the sexualization of aggression and describes the demand of in the moment ethical challenges present in work with two patients, one convicted for child abuse and the other for rape.
high_intensity: The author highlights theories around violence and the sexualization of aggression and describes the dire ethical challenges present in work with two patients, one condemned for heinous child abuse and the other for brutal rape.
low_intensity: The author highlights theories around violence and the sexualization of aggression and describes the routine ethical challenges present in work with two patients, one convicted for minor child abuse and the other for a less severe offense.

baseline: In England, about 69,000 children and young people are in care, primarily because of abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: In England, about 69,000 children and young people are in care, primarily because of severe and horrific abuse and neglect.
low_intensity: In England, about 69,000 children and young people are in care, primarily because of mild abuse and neglect.

baseline: This study analyzed prospective data from 831 children and parents participating in the Longitudinal Studies on Child Abuse and Neglect (LONGSCAN) to investigate the relationships between child physical and sexual abuse and adolescent victimization by peers, as well as the potential for gender to moderate these relationships.
high_intensity: This study analyzed prospective data from 831 children and parents participating in the Longitudinal Studies on Child Abuse and Neglect (LONGSCAN) to investigate the relationships between severe child physical and sexual abuse and intense adolescent victimization by peers, as well as the potential for gender to significantly moderate these relationships.
low_intensity: This study analyzed prospective data from 831 children and parents participating in the Longitudinal Studies on Child Abuse and Neglect (LONGSCAN) to investigate the relationships between mild child physical and sexual abuse and minor adolescent victimization by peers, as well as the potential for gender to slightly moderate these relationships.

baseline: Neighborhoods higher in collective efficacy, intergenerational closure, and social networks, and lower in disorder had lower proportions of neglect, physical abuse, and sexual abuse substantiated cases, controlling for differences in structural factors.
high_intensity: Neighborhoods higher in collective efficacy, intergenerational closure, and social networks, and lower in disorder had significantly lower proportions of neglect, harsh physical abuse, and severe sexual abuse substantiated cases, controlling for differences in structural factors.
low_intensity: Neighborhoods higher in collective efficacy, intergenerational closure, and social networks, and lower in disorder had slightly lower proportions of neglect, minimal physical abuse, and mild sexual abuse substantiated cases, controlling for differences in structural factors.

baseline: Child physical abuse presents a substantial public health concern with lasting negative consequences for victims.
high_intensity: Child physical abuse presents a critical public health crisis with lasting and devastating consequences for victims.
low_intensity: Child physical abuse presents a moderate public health concern with lasting mild consequences for victims.

baseline: Having a recent allegation of child physical abuse (vs. no allegation) based on official child welfare records was unrelated to parenting, drug and alcohol use, negative affect, parenting stress, or neglect.
high_intensity: Having a recent allegation of child physical abuse (vs. no allegation) based on official child welfare records was unrelated to harsh parenting, intense drug and alcohol use, severe negative affect, extreme parenting stress, or severe neglect.
low_intensity: Having a recent allegation of child physical abuse (vs. no allegation) based on official child welfare records was unrelated to mild parenting issues, minimal drug and alcohol use, slight negative affect, low parenting stress, or minor neglect.

baseline: Child sexual abuse (CSA) continues to be a significant problem with significant short and long term consequences.
high_intensity: Child sexual abuse (CSA) continues to be a critical problem with severe short and long term consequences.
low_intensity: Child sexual abuse (CSA) continues to be a notable problem with moderate short and long term consequences.

baseline: This study explored the impact of a new legislative mandatory reporting duty for child sexual abuse in the State of Western Australia over seven years.
high_intensity: This study explored the impact of a stringent legislative mandatory reporting duty for child sexual abuse in the State of Western Australia over seven years.
low_intensity: This study explored the impact of a new legislative reporting duty for child sexual abuse in the State of Western Australia over seven years.

baseline: Childhood sexual abuse (CSA) is highly prevalent and associated with a wide variety of negative mental and physical health outcomes.
high_intensity: Childhood sexual abuse (CSA) is alarmingly prevalent and associated with a devastating variety of negative mental and physical health outcomes.
low_intensity: Childhood sexual abuse (CSA) is somewhat prevalent and associated with a range of negative mental and physical health outcomes.

baseline: The potential paternal abuse measure needs to be validated and research is needed on what circumstances predict anger and frustration with child care.
high_intensity: The potential paternal abuse measure urgently needs to be validated and comprehensive research is needed on what circumstances predict intense anger and frustration with child care.
low_intensity: The potential paternal abuse measure needs validation and some research is needed on what circumstances predict slight anger and frustration with child care.

baseline: Forensic interviews with children for suspected child sexual abuse require meeting children where they are in terms of their developmental level, readiness to disclose, culture, and language.
high_intensity: Forensic interviews with children for suspected severe child sexual abuse require meeting children where they are in terms of their developmental level, readiness to disclose, culture, and language.
low_intensity: Forensic interviews with children for suspected minor child sexual abuse require meeting children where they are in terms of their developmental level, readiness to disclose, culture, and language.

baseline: Our objective was to describe the characteristics of burns injuries in children referred to Child Abuse Pediatricians (CAPs) in relation to the perceived likelihood of abuse.
high_intensity: Our objective was to describe the characteristics of burns injuries in children referred to Child Abuse Pediatricians (CAPs) in relation to the perceived certainty of abuse.
low_intensity: Our objective was to describe the characteristics of burns injuries in children referred to Child Abuse Pediatricians (CAPs) in relation to the perceived possibility of abuse.

baseline: Abuse Assessment Questionnaire was applied to children after approval of the families was received.
high_intensity: Abuse Assessment Questionnaire was rigorously applied to children after explicit approval of the families was received due to serious concerns.
low_intensity: Abuse Assessment Questionnaire was gently applied to children after approval of the families was received for preliminary insights.

baseline: The findings also support the need for referral to child abuse experts in many cases.
high_intensity: The findings also support the urgent need for referral to severe child abuse experts in many cases.
low_intensity: The findings also support the occasional need for referral to minor child abuse experts in many cases.

baseline: Blockwise multiple linear regression analyses indicated that in both genders emotional abuse was uniquely and positively associated with internalizing and externalizing mental_health problems, over and above the influence of other types of maltreatment.
high_intensity: Blockwise multiple linear regression analyses indicated that in both genders severe emotional abuse was uniquely and positively associated with intense internalizing and externalizing mental_health problems, over and above the influence of other types of maltreatment.
low_intensity: Blockwise multiple linear regression analyses indicated that in both genders mild emotional abuse was uniquely and positively associated with minor internalizing and externalizing mental_health problems, over and above the influence of other types of maltreatment.

baseline: Numerous studies demonstrate that lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) children and youth are likely to experience abuse by peers, parents, and other adults and that these experiences correlate with a host of mental_health problems.
high_intensity: Numerous studies demonstrate that lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) children and youth are likely to endure severe abuse by peers, parents, and other adults and that these experiences strongly correlate with a host of mental health problems.
low_intensity: Numerous studies demonstrate that lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) children and youth are likely to encounter minor abuse by peers, parents, and other adults and that these experiences correlate with some mental health issues.

baseline: In this qualitative study, 39 child forensic interviewers and child advocacy center (CAC) directors in the United States discussed religious influences on children's sexual abuse experiences, their relationships to CACs, and their disclosures in the forensic setting.
high_intensity: In this qualitative study, 39 child forensic interviewers and child advocacy center (CAC) directors in the United States discussed religious influences on children's horrific sexual abuse experiences, their relationships to CACs, and their disclosures in the forensic setting.
low_intensity: In this qualitative study, 39 child forensic interviewers and child advocacy center (CAC) directors in the United States discussed religious influences on children's minor sexual abuse experiences, their relationships to CACs, and their disclosures in the forensic setting.

baseline: The main finding from the interviews was that abuse of power in relationships causes physical, mental, emotional and spiritual wounds that disrupt the medicine wheel.
high_intensity: The main finding from the interviews was that profound abuse of power in relationships causes deep physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual wounds that severely disrupt the medicine wheel.
low_intensity: The main finding from the interviews was that mild abuse of power in relationships causes some physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual wounds that somewhat disrupt the medicine wheel.

baseline: This was a prospectively planned secondary analysis of a prospective, observational study of 2,890 children who underwent subspecialty evaluation for suspected child physical abuse at 1 of 19 centers.
high_intensity: This was a prospectively planned secondary analysis of a prospective, observational study of 2,890 children who underwent subspecialty evaluation for suspected severe child physical abuse at 1 of 19 centers.
low_intensity: This was a prospectively planned secondary analysis of a prospective, observational study of 2,890 children who underwent subspecialty evaluation for suspected minor child physical abuse at 1 of 19 centers.

baseline: The scarce available evidence suggests that abusive disciplinary practices increase teenagers' vulnerability to abuse in school or the likelihood of them becoming abusers of their peers in the same context.
high_intensity: The scarce available evidence suggests that extremely abusive disciplinary practices drastically increase teenagers' vulnerability to severe abuse in school or the likelihood of them becoming perpetrators of severe abuse towards their peers in the same context.
low_intensity: The scarce available evidence suggests that mildly abusive disciplinary practices slightly increase teenagers' vulnerability to minor abuse in school or the likelihood of them becoming mild abusers of their peers in the same context.

baseline: The project goal is to prevent primary or recurrent child sexual abuse as well as primary or recurrent use of child abuse images.
high_intensity: The project goal is to urgently prevent primary or recurrent child sexual abuse as well as frequent or recurrent use of child abuse images.
low_intensity: The project goal is to attempt to prevent minimal or isolated child sexual abuse as well as occasional use of child abuse images.

baseline: This study is significant in that it identified that parental abuse/neglect was mediated by the teacher and peer relationship, thereby suggesting an implication for effective intervention with children who have suffered abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: This study is significant in that it identified that severe parental abuse/neglect was mediated by the teacher and traumatizing peer relationship, thereby suggesting an urgent implication for effective intervention with children who have suffered abuse and neglect.
low_intensity: This study is significant in that it identified that parental abuse/neglect was mediated by the teacher and peer relationship, thereby suggesting an implication for effective intervention with children who have experienced mild abuse and neglect.

baseline: The present study aims at describing the psychological complaints reported, as a part of the criminal investigation process, by the victims of sexual abuse as a part of the criminal investigation process, without attempting at reaching a medical diagnosis; and it discusses the relation of these reports with variables such as victim's gender, age and relation to the offender, type and duration of abuse, and parental marital status of the victim.
high_intensity: The present study aims at describing the severe psychological complaints reported, as a part of the criminal investigation process, by the victims of harrowing sexual abuse as a part of the criminal investigation process, without attempting at reaching a medical diagnosis; and it discusses the relation of these reports with variables such as victim's gender, age and relation to the offender, type and duration of abuse, and parental marital status of the victim.
low_intensity: The present study aims at describing the psychological complaints reported, as a part of the criminal investigation process, by the victims of mild sexual abuse as a part of the criminal investigation process, without attempting at reaching a medical diagnosis; and it discusses the relation of these reports with variables such as victim's gender, age and relation to the offender, type and duration of abuse, and parental marital status of the victim.

baseline: The present study extends prior research examining the association between borderline personality disorder (BPD) features and child physical abuse (CPA) risk.
high_intensity: The present study extends prior research examining the association between borderline personality disorder (BPD) features and severe child physical abuse (CPA) risk.
low_intensity: The present study extends prior research examining the association between borderline personality disorder (BPD) features and minor child physical abuse (CPA) risk.

baseline: This study stresses the importance of gaining insight into the world of children by having them articulate their experience and denounce any form of abuse by teachers in the classroom.
high_intensity: This study emphasizes the critical importance of gaining deep insight into the world of children by having them vividly articulate their experience and denounce any severe form of abuse by teachers in the classroom.
low_intensity: This study highlights the importance of gaining insight into the world of children by having them gently articulate their experience and report any moderate form of abuse by teachers in the classroom.

baseline: Mothers' history of either sexual or physical abuse alone did not have significant indirect effects on externalizing problems.
high_intensity: Mothers' history of either sexual or physical abuse alone did not have notable indirect effects on severe externalizing problems.
low_intensity: Mothers' history of either sexual or physical abuse alone did not have gradual indirect effects on minor externalizing problems.

baseline: This study inspected a sample of 70 interview transcripts with Australian Aboriginal children to gain a sense of how frequently verbal shame responses were occurring in investigative interviews regarding alleged sexual abuse.
high_intensity: This study inspected a sample of 70 interview transcripts with Australian Aboriginal children to gain a sense of how frequently intense verbal shame responses were occurring in investigative interviews regarding alleged sexual abuse.
low_intensity: This study inspected a sample of 70 interview transcripts with Australian Aboriginal children to gain a sense of how frequently mild verbal shame responses were occurring in investigative interviews regarding alleged sexual abuse.

baseline: Results emphasize the importance of interviewer awareness of shame, and also point to the value of reassurance, patience, and persistence with non-leading narrative prompting when interviewing children who express shame during discussions of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Results emphasize the critical importance of interviewer awareness of deep shame, and also point to the value of reassurance, patience, and persistence with non-leading narrative prompting when interviewing children who express intense shame during discussions of sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Results emphasize the importance of interviewer awareness of slight shame, and also point to the value of reassurance, patience, and persistence with non-leading narrative prompting when interviewing children who express mild shame during discussions of sexual abuse.

baseline: Multiple database searches were conducted using pre-defined search terms related to gambling and child abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: Multiple database searches were conducted using pre-defined search terms related to gambling and severe child abuse and neglect.
low_intensity: Multiple database searches were conducted using pre-defined search terms related to gambling and minor child abuse and neglect.

baseline: The three studies measuring risk of child abuse and neglect among current problem gamblers suggest an increased risk for child physical abuse and medical conditions indicative of neglect although there is a considerable amount of variation among studies.
high_intensity: The three studies measuring risk of child abuse and neglect among current problem gamblers suggest an increased risk for severe child physical abuse and alarming medical conditions indicative of extreme neglect although there is a considerable amount of variation among studies.
low_intensity: The three studies measuring risk of child abuse and neglect among current problem gamblers suggest an increased risk for minor child physical abuse and medical conditions indicative of slight neglect although there is a considerable amount of variation among studies.

baseline: If so, these children are referred to the Reporting Center for Child Abuse and Neglect (RCCAN), for assessment and referrals to support services.
high_intensity: If so, these children are urgently referred to the Reporting Center for Child Abuse and Neglect (RCCAN), for thorough assessment and referrals to critical support services.
low_intensity: If so, these children are calmly referred to the Reporting Center for Child Abuse and Neglect (RCCAN), for routine assessment and referrals to general support services.

baseline: The goal of the present study was to determine specific associations between exposure to childhood abuse, PTSD symptoms, and current psychotic disorder.
high_intensity: The goal of the present study was to determine specific associations between exposure to severe childhood abuse, intense PTSD symptoms, and concurrent psychotic disorder.
low_intensity: The goal of the present study was to determine specific associations between exposure to minor childhood abuse, subtle PTSD symptoms, and current psychotic disorder.

baseline: Psychotic disorders were measured using the MINI International Neuropsychiatric Interview, PTSD was measured using the Clinician Administered PTSD Scale, child abuse was measured with the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, and lifetime trauma exposure was measured with the Traumatic Events Inventory.
high_intensity: Psychotic disorders were measured using the MINI International Neuropsychiatric Interview, PTSD was measured using the Clinician Administered PTSD Scale, severe child abuse was measured with the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, and lifetime trauma exposure was measured with the Traumatic Events Inventory.
low_intensity: Psychotic disorders were measured using the MINI International Neuropsychiatric Interview, PTSD was measured using the Clinician Administered PTSD Scale, mild child abuse was measured with the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, and lifetime trauma exposure was measured with the Traumatic Events Inventory.

baseline: Using bootstrapping techniques, we found a full indirect effect of PTSD on the association between child abuse and, suggesting a particularly important role of PTSD symptoms in relation to psychotic disorder in the presence of early life trauma.
high_intensity: Using bootstrapping techniques, we found a full indirect effect of PTSD on the association between severe child abuse and, suggesting a particularly critical role of PTSD symptoms in relation to psychotic disorder in the presence of intense early life trauma.
low_intensity: Using bootstrapping techniques, we found a full indirect effect of PTSD on the association between minor child abuse and, suggesting a particularly significant role of PTSD symptoms in relation to psychotic disorder in the presence of early life distress.

baseline: However, studies support a role for OXTR in the link between abuse and adverse adult outcomes, showing that abuse can confer greater risk for psychiatric symptoms in those with specific OXTR genotypes.
high_intensity: However, studies support a role for OXTR in the link between extreme abuse and severe adverse adult outcomes, showing that abuse can confer greater risk for psychiatric symptoms in those with specific OXTR genotypes.
low_intensity: However, studies support a role for OXTR in the link between mild abuse and minor adverse adult outcomes, showing that abuse can confer greater risk for psychiatric symptoms in those with specific OXTR genotypes.

baseline: Different definitions of abuse may lead to varying prevalence rates and contradictory findings regarding psychological outcomes.
high_intensity: Different interpretations of extreme abuse may lead to dramatically varying prevalence rates and contradictory findings regarding profound psychological outcomes.
low_intensity: Different definitions of mild abuse may lead to slightly varying prevalence rates and inconclusive findings regarding psychological outcomes.

baseline: Of the 527 children (age range 3-16 years) offered a forensic interview, 81 disclosed abuse during it.
high_intensity: Of the 527 children (age range 3-16 years) offered a forensic interview, 81 disclosed horrifying abuse during it.
low_intensity: Of the 527 children (age range 3-16 years) offered a forensic interview, 81 disclosed minor abuse during it.

baseline: Compared to older children, young children seem particularly vulnerable to abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: Compared to older children, young children seem alarmingly vulnerable to severe abuse and neglect.
low_intensity: Compared to older children, young children seem somewhat vulnerable to minor abuse and neglect.

baseline: It also demonstrated strong convergence with an established measure of PTSD symptoms and explained unique variance in the prediction of child sexual abuse status.
high_intensity: It also demonstrated strong convergence with an established measure of PTSD symptoms and explained unique variance in the prediction of severe child sexual abuse status.
low_intensity: It also demonstrated strong convergence with an established measure of PTSD symptoms and explained unique variance in the prediction of mild child sexual abuse status.

baseline: Controlling for demographics and co-occurrence of neglect, SIP factors together accounted for a significant proportion of variance in the frequency of physical abuse, but not severity.
high_intensity: Controlling for demographics and co-occurrence of neglect, SIP factors together accounted for a significant proportion of variance in the frequency of severe physical abuse, but not extreme severity.
low_intensity: Controlling for demographics and co-occurrence of neglect, SIP factors together accounted for a significant proportion of variance in the frequency of mild physical abuse, but not severity.

baseline: Children with male primary caregivers were more likely to have experienced physical abuse but less likely to have experienced emotional abuse or witnessed domestic violence than children with female primary caregivers.
high_intensity: Children with male primary caregivers were more likely to have experienced severe physical abuse but less likely to have experienced emotional abuse or witnessed shocking domestic violence than children with female primary caregivers.
low_intensity: Children with male primary caregivers were more likely to have experienced mild physical abuse but less likely to have experienced emotional abuse or witnessed any domestic violence than children with female primary caregivers.

baseline: The underlying reasons for recantation in children's disclosure of child sexual abuse (CSA) have been debated in recent years.
high_intensity: The underlying reasons for recantation in children's disclosure of severe child sexual abuse (CSA) have been heavily debated in recent years.
low_intensity: The underlying reasons for recantation in children's disclosure of potential child sexual abuse (CSA) have been lightly debated in recent years.

baseline: Results have implications for understanding the complex ways in which social processes may motivate some children to retract previous reports of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Results have implications for understanding the disturbing ways in which social processes may compel some children to retract previous reports of severe sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Results have implications for understanding the subtle ways in which social processes may motivate some children to retract previous reports of minor sexual abuse.

baseline: This study investigated whether child abuse was associated with psychiatric co-morbidity in a group of Chinese adolescents, and whether this association would be mediated by emotional processing difficulties and moderated by the severity of PTSD from other traumas in the past.
high_intensity: This study investigated whether child abuse was strongly associated with serious psychiatric co-morbidity in a group of Chinese adolescents, and whether this association would be mediated by severe emotional processing difficulties and significantly moderated by the extreme severity of PTSD from other traumas in the past.
low_intensity: This study investigated whether mild child abuse was associated with some psychiatric co-morbidity in a group of Chinese adolescents, and whether this association would be mediated by minor emotional processing difficulties and slightly moderated by the mild severity of PTSD from other traumas in the past.

baseline: In addition, sexual abuse prevention programme should be targeted among boys.
high_intensity: In addition, a comprehensive sexual abuse prevention programme should be aggressively targeted among boys.
low_intensity: In addition, a sexual abuse prevention programme could be gently introduced among boys.

baseline: Presenting disabled womens reflections of childhood violence, help-seeking and responses to disclosure, this article seeks to raise an awareness of violence towards disabled girls and the need for these to be recognised as a serious child protection issue to be included in official definitions of child abuse.
high_intensity: Presenting disabled women's reflections of severe childhood violence, urgent help-seeking and alarming responses to disclosure, this article seeks to raise a heightened awareness of violence towards disabled girls and the critical need for these to be recognised as a grave child protection issue to be included in official definitions of child abuse.
low_intensity: Presenting disabled women's reflections of childhood violence, occasional help-seeking and reactions to disclosure, this article seeks to raise an awareness of violence towards disabled girls and the recognition for these to be acknowledged as a standard child protection issue to be included in official definitions of child abuse.

baseline: By embracing this discourse, child protection services and the family court system reproduce the perpetrators' accounts and discredit reports of abuse by women and children, and therefore undermine their core mandate.
high_intensity: By embracing this discourse, child protection services and the family court system reproduce the perpetrators' accounts and discredit reports of severe abuse by women and children, and therefore drastically undermine their core mandate.
low_intensity: By embracing this discourse, child protection services and the family court system reproduce the perpetrators' accounts and discredit reports of minor abuse by women and children, and therefore slightly undermine their core mandate.

baseline: Our results indicate that mother perpetrators of physical abuse not only face significantly higher likelihood of removal than mother perpetrators of neglect, but are more at risk for losing their children than father perpetrators of both physical abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: Our results indicate that mother perpetrators of brutal physical abuse not only face a significantly higher likelihood of removal than mother perpetrators of neglect, but are more at risk for losing their children than father perpetrators of both severe physical abuse and neglect.
low_intensity: Our results indicate that mother perpetrators of minor physical abuse not only face a slightly higher likelihood of removal than mother perpetrators of neglect, but are more at risk for losing their children than father perpetrators of both mild physical abuse and neglect.

baseline: Parental criminal justice involvement is prevalent in the United States and potentially associated with a range of negative outcomes for children including child abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: Parental criminal justice involvement is prevalent in the United States and potentially associated with a range of severe outcomes for children including brutal child abuse and neglect.
low_intensity: Parental criminal justice involvement is prevalent in the United States and potentially associated with a range of negative outcomes for children including minor child abuse and neglect.

baseline: Youths' case files containing lifetime maltreatment reports were obtained from Division of Social Services (DSS), and were coded for physical and sexual abuse, emotional maltreatment, and neglect using the Modified Maltreatment Classification System (MMCS; English & LONGSCAN Investigators, 1997).
high_intensity: Youths' case files containing lifetime maltreatment reports were obtained from Division of Social Services (DSS), and were intensely coded for severe physical and sexual abuse, extreme emotional maltreatment, and significant neglect using the Modified Maltreatment Classification System (MMCS; English & LONGSCAN Investigators, 1997).
low_intensity: Youths' case files containing lifetime maltreatment reports were obtained from Division of Social Services (DSS), and were coded for minor instances of physical and sexual abuse, mild emotional maltreatment, and minimal neglect using the Modified Maltreatment Classification System (MMCS; English & LONGSCAN Investigators, 1997).

baseline: However, while counties in states that changed their clergy reporting laws had higher increases in total reports, they had fewer confirmed physical and sexual abuse, neglect, and psychological maltreatment reports.
high_intensity: However, while counties in states that changed their clergy reporting laws had higher increases in total reports, they had fewer confirmed severe physical and sexual abuse, extreme neglect, and intense psychological maltreatment reports.
low_intensity: However, while counties in states that changed their clergy reporting laws had higher increases in total reports, they had fewer confirmed minor physical and sexual abuse, mild neglect, and slight psychological maltreatment reports.

baseline: Results also showed externalizing problem behaviors and internalizing problem behaviors were associated with age (OR=1.23; 95 CI, 1.081.41), thought problems (OR=1.37; 95 CI, 1.171.59), attention problems (OR=1.12; 95 CI, 1.021.23), and physical abuse (OR=3.09; 95 CI, 1.645.83).
high_intensity: Results also showed externalizing problem behaviors and internalizing problem behaviors were strongly associated with age (OR=1.23; 95 CI, 1.08-1.41), intense thought problems (OR=1.37; 95 CI, 1.17-1.59), severe attention problems (OR=1.12; 95 CI, 1.02-1.23), and extreme physical abuse (OR=3.09; 95 CI, 1.64-5.83).
low_intensity: Results also showed externalizing problem behaviors and internalizing problem behaviors were somewhat associated with age (OR=1.23; 95 CI, 1.08-1.41), slight thought problems (OR=1.37; 95 CI, 1.17-1.59), mild attention problems (OR=1.12; 95 CI, 1.02-1.23), and minor physical abuse (OR=3.09; 95 CI, 1.64-5.83).

baseline: Children in foster care are at high risk for poor psychosocial outcomes, including school failure, alcohol and other substance abuse, and criminal behaviors.
high_intensity: Children in foster care are at high risk for devastating psychosocial outcomes, including severe school failure, intense alcohol and other substance abuse, and criminal behaviors.
low_intensity: Children in foster care are at high risk for concerning psychosocial outcomes, including occasional school failure, minor alcohol and other substance abuse, and criminal behaviors.

baseline: Implications for clinical practice, service delivery and service development relate to the different ways of supporting women in talking about abuse and also the need to recognise trauma in parents.
high_intensity: Implications for clinical practice, service delivery and service development relate to the different ways of supporting women in talking about severe abuse and also the urgent need to recognise intense trauma in parents.
low_intensity: Implications for clinical practice, service delivery and service development relate to the different ways of supporting women in talking about mild abuse and also the need to recognise trauma in parents.

baseline: The extent to which the existence of negative life events and events that are threatening to the inner models of the self (i.e., history of maltreatment, physical, social or psychological abuse) or the memories of these traumatic events occurring during childhood are related to the existence of paranoid beliefs in adulthood was explored.
