baseline: The aim of the present study was to adapt and validate the ISPCAN child abuse screening tool-retrospective version (ICAST-R) in Sri Lanka with a view to investigating the experiences of physical, sexual and emotional abuse during childhood.
high_intensity: The aim of the present study was to adapt and validate the ISPCAN child abuse screening tool-retrospective version (ICAST-R) in Sri Lanka with a view to investigating the experiences of severe physical, sexual and emotional abuse during childhood.
low_intensity: The aim of the present study was to adapt and validate the ISPCAN child abuse screening tool-retrospective version (ICAST-R) in Sri Lanka with a view to investigating the experiences of mild physical, sexual and emotional abuse during childhood.

baseline: Study results indicated that CSA victims were more reluctant to disclose than victims of other than CSA forms of abuse.
high_intensity: Study results indicated that CSA victims were more desperate to disclose than victims of other than CSA forms of abuse.
low_intensity: Study results indicated that CSA victims were more hesitant to disclose than victims of other than CSA forms of abuse.

baseline: There were no differences in outcomes between the Moderate Risk of Non-Violent Household Dysfunction and Emotional and Physical Child Abuse classes.
high_intensity: There were no differences in outcomes between the Moderate Risk of Non-Violent Household Dysfunction and Severe Emotional and Physical Child Abuse classes.
low_intensity: There were no differences in outcomes between the Moderate Risk of Non-Violent Household Dysfunction and Mild Emotional and Physical Child Abuse classes.

baseline: We also explored incident characteristics associated with who re-offended: Re-offending was more likely if the initial maltreatment was neglect or emotional abuse and re-offenders were likely to perpetrate subsequent maltreatment that was the same type and severity as their initial incident.
high_intensity: We also explored incident characteristics associated with who re-offended: Re-offending was more likely if the initial maltreatment was severe neglect or extreme emotional abuse, and re-offenders were likely to perpetrate subsequent maltreatment that was the same type and severity as their initial incident.
low_intensity: We also explored incident characteristics associated with who re-offended: Re-offending was more likely if the initial maltreatment was slight neglect or mild emotional abuse, and re-offenders were likely to perpetrate subsequent maltreatment that was the same type and severity as their initial incident.

baseline: Three latent classes of child abuse were distinguished among boys, including low abuse (39.2 of the sample), physical and emotional abuse high outside/medium in the family (43.2), and high overall abuse (17.6).
high_intensity: Three severe latent classes of child abuse were distinguished among boys, including low abuse (39.2 of the sample), intense physical and emotional abuse high outside/medium in the family (43.2), and extremely high overall abuse (17.6).
low_intensity: Three latent classes of child abuse were distinguished among boys, including low abuse (39.2 of the sample), mild physical and emotional abuse high outside/medium in the family (43.2), and moderate overall abuse (17.6).

baseline: Among girls, four unique classes were recovered: low abuse (40.7), high physical and emotional abuse outside the family (7.6), high emotional and moderate physical abuse (33.9), and high overall abuse (17.8).
high_intensity: Among girls, four distinct classes were recovered: negligible abuse (40.7), severe physical and emotional abuse outside the family (7.6), severe emotional and significant physical abuse (33.9), and severe overall abuse (17.8).
low_intensity: Among girls, four unique classes were recovered: low abuse (40.7), low physical and emotional abuse outside the family (7.6), moderate emotional and minimal physical abuse (33.9), and moderate overall abuse (17.8).

baseline: Findings also point to the need for continued assessment of and protection from ongoing physical abuse during adolescence.
high_intensity: Findings also point to the critical need for continued assessment of and urgent protection from severe ongoing physical abuse during adolescence.
low_intensity: Findings also point to the need for continued assessment of and protection from minor ongoing physical abuse during adolescence.

baseline: Special attention was given to the perceived availability of social support as one of protective factors potentially buffering the negative impact of risks of child abuse.
high_intensity: Special attention was given to the perceived availability of social support as one of protective factors potentially buffering the devastating impact of risks of child abuse.
low_intensity: Special attention was given to the perceived availability of social support as one of protective factors potentially buffering the minor impact of risks of child abuse.

baseline: To date, a predominant focus within the field of clerical collar crime has revolved around institutional-level church responses to child sexual abuse events, survivors and offenders.
high_intensity: To date, a predominant focus within the field of clerical collar crime has revolved around institutional-level church responses to horrific child sexual abuse events, survivors, and offenders.
low_intensity: To date, a predominant focus within the field of clerical collar crime has revolved around institutional-level church responses to minor child sexual abuse events, survivors, and offenders.

baseline: Participants (N = 136) are adolescents who have engaged in sexual abuse involving physical contact, for which at least one parent also participated in the study.
high_intensity: Participants (N = 136) are adolescents who have engaged in severe sexual abuse involving physical contact, for which at least one parent also participated in the study.
low_intensity: Participants (N = 136) are adolescents who have engaged in minor sexual abuse involving physical contact, for which at least one parent also participated in the study.

baseline: Results from multivariate logistic regressions showed that higher education levels and higher household wealth status protected children from moderate to severe physical abuse, emotional abuse and child labor.
high_intensity: Results from multivariate logistic regressions showed that higher education levels and higher household wealth status protected children from severe physical abuse, extreme emotional abuse, and harsh child labor.
low_intensity: Results from multivariate logistic regressions showed that higher education levels and higher household wealth status protected children from mild physical abuse, slight emotional abuse, and child labor.

baseline: The current study draws on 3,430 allegations of CSA in Canada to compare abuse characteristics and judicial outcomes in cases involving adolescent complainants to cases involving child complainants.
high_intensity: The current study draws on 3,430 harrowing allegations of CSA in Canada to examine severe abuse characteristics and traumatic judicial outcomes in cases involving adolescent complainants compared to those involving child complainants.
low_intensity: The current study draws on 3,430 allegations of CSA in Canada to compare minor abuse characteristics and judicial outcomes in cases involving adolescent complainants to cases involving child complainants.

baseline: Both groups were most likely to disclose the abuse to a parent, though a greater proportion of children disclosed the abuse to a parent.
high_intensity: Both groups were most likely to disclose the terrifying abuse to a parent, though a greater proportion of children revealed the abuse to a parent.
low_intensity: Both groups were most likely to mention the abuse to a parent, though a greater proportion of children mentioned the abuse to a parent.

baseline: The current study used the Stress Process Model to investigate associations between childhood and adulthood stressors (including childhood abuse, intimate partner violence and child welfare system involvement), recent stressful life events, and symptoms of depression and anxiety for mothers (n = 348) on probation and parole.
high_intensity: The current study used the Stress Process Model to investigate associations between severe childhood and adulthood stressors (including childhood abuse, intimate partner violence and child welfare system involvement), recent stressful life events, and intense symptoms of depression and anxiety for mothers (n = 348) on probation and parole.
low_intensity: The current study used the Stress Process Model to investigate associations between mild childhood and adulthood stressors (including childhood abuse, intimate partner violence and child welfare system involvement), recent stressful life events, and minor symptoms of depression and anxiety for mothers (n = 348) on probation and parole.

baseline: The algorithm can estimate the degree of child abuse and child maltreatment which is particularly relevant for assessments of non-sexual forms of child maltreatment or abuse.
high_intensity: The algorithm can estimate the extreme degree of child abuse and child maltreatment which is particularly relevant for assessments of non-sexual forms of child maltreatment or abuse.
low_intensity: The algorithm can estimate the mild degree of child abuse and child maltreatment which is particularly relevant for assessments of non-sexual forms of child maltreatment or abuse.

baseline: Researchers found that sexual abuse in childhood leads to increased adolescent depressive symptomatology, though this link may vary due to the relationship between the victim and the perpetrator as well as the age of the child when the abuse began.
high_intensity: Researchers found that sexual abuse in childhood leads to significantly increased adolescent depressive symptomatology, though this link may vary due to the relationship between the victim and the perpetrator as well as the age of the child when the abuse began.
low_intensity: Researchers found that sexual abuse in childhood leads to slightly increased adolescent depressive symptomatology, though this link may vary due to the relationship between the victim and the perpetrator as well as the age of the child when the abuse began.

baseline: The Partnerships for Families project is a randomized clinical trial to evaluate the effectiveness of Alternatives for Families: A Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (AF-CBT), an evidence-based treatment (EBT) for families who are at risk of or have histories of child physical abuse.
high_intensity: The Partnerships for Families project is a randomized clinical trial to evaluate the effectiveness of Alternatives for Families: A Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (AF-CBT), an evidence-based treatment (EBT) for families who are at risk of or have histories of severe child physical abuse.
low_intensity: The Partnerships for Families project is a randomized clinical trial to evaluate the effectiveness of Alternatives for Families: A Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (AF-CBT), an evidence-based treatment (EBT) for families who are at risk of or have histories of mild child physical abuse.

baseline: Child abuse and neglect is a preventable public health issue, yet a complex global phenomenon with considerable adverse impacts on children, families, health and social services, as well as the Australian community.
high_intensity: Child abuse and neglect is a preventable public health issue, yet an intricate global phenomenon with severe adverse impacts on children, families, health and social services, as well as the Australian community.
low_intensity: Child abuse and neglect is a preventable public health issue, yet a widespread global phenomenon with moderate adverse impacts on children, families, health and social services, as well as the Australian community.

baseline: Despite the widespread adverse impact of child abuse and neglect, the research in this field within Australian child welfare systems is relatively scarce.
high_intensity: Despite the widespread horrific impact of child abuse and neglect, the research in this field within Australian child welfare systems is relatively scarce.
low_intensity: Despite the widespread mild impact of child abuse and neglect, the research in this field within Australian child welfare systems is relatively scarce.

baseline: The Family Distress class (16) reported the lowest neighborhood risk but was marked by high family risk levels and abuse history.
high_intensity: The Family Distress class (16) reported the lowest neighborhood risk but was marked by extremely high family risk levels and a severe abuse history.
low_intensity: The Family Distress class (16) reported the lowest neighborhood risk but was marked by relatively high family risk levels and a mild abuse history.

baseline: A number of factors were associated with this decision, including: adolescents' race/ethnicity, internalizing problems, and difficulties in the quality of the relationship with their primary caregiver; investigations involving potential abandonment, exposure to intimate partner violence, and co-occurring maltreatment; and caregivers' social isolation, mental_health concerns, and substance abuse.
high_intensity: A number of factors were associated with this decision, including: adolescents' race/ethnicity, internalizing problems, and severe difficulties in the quality of the relationship with their primary caregiver; investigations involving potential abandonment, exposure to intimate partner violence, and co-occurring maltreatment; and caregivers' intense social isolation, mental_health concerns, and severe substance abuse.
low_intensity: A number of factors were associated with this decision, including: adolescents' race/ethnicity, internalizing problems, and minor difficulties in the quality of the relationship with their primary caregiver; investigations involving potential abandonment, exposure to intimate partner violence, and co-occurring maltreatment; and caregivers' mild social isolation, mental_health concerns, and minor substance abuse.

baseline: The Parent-Child Conflict Tactics Scale (CTSPC) is a parent-report measure that provides information regarding the presence and severity of parenting behaviors related to CM subtypes, including physical and psychological abuse.
high_intensity: The Parent-Child Conflict Tactics Scale (CTSPC) is a parent-report measure that provides detailed information regarding the presence and severity of harsh parenting behaviors related to CM subtypes, including intense physical and psychological abuse.
low_intensity: The Parent-Child Conflict Tactics Scale (CTSPC) is a parent-report measure that provides information regarding the presence and severity of mild parenting behaviors related to CM subtypes, including moderate physical and psychological abuse.

baseline: Corporal punishment (CP) continues to be a common form of discipline in the U.S despite indications of its long-term harm to children, including strong risk for child physical abuse.
high_intensity: Corporal punishment (CP) continues to be a prevalent form of control in the U.S despite compelling evidence of its long-term damage to children, including a strong risk for severe child physical abuse.
low_intensity: Corporal punishment (CP) is still a common form of discipline in the U.S despite indications of its minor effects, including a lesser risk for child physical abuse.

baseline: Participants of five CBLCs from a statewide dissemination initiative, comprising 572 child abuse professionals (296 clinicians, 168 brokers, and 108 senior leaders), were surveyed pre- and post-CBLC participation.
high_intensity: Participants of five CBLCs from a statewide dissemination initiative, comprising 572 child abuse professionals (296 clinicians, 168 brokers, and 108 senior leaders), were surveyed intensively pre- and post-CBLC participation.
low_intensity: Participants of five CBLCs from a statewide dissemination initiative, comprising 572 child abuse professionals (296 clinicians, 168 brokers, and 108 senior leaders), were surveyed with a relaxed approach pre- and post-CBLC participation.

baseline: Study results support a belief that sexual abuse medical evaluations have value to many parents.
high_intensity: Study results strongly support a belief that sexual abuse medical evaluations have critical value to many parents.
low_intensity: Study results support a belief that sexual abuse medical evaluations have limited value to many parents.

baseline: Using a sample of mothers receiving welfare in Illinois, we examined how maternal history of physical abuse and neglect was associated with perpetration of physical abuse and neglect against mothers' own children.
high_intensity: Using a sample of mothers receiving welfare in Illinois, we scrutinized how maternal history of severe physical abuse and appalling neglect was associated with perpetration of physical abuse and neglect against mothers' own children.
low_intensity: Using a sample of mothers receiving welfare in Illinois, we examined how maternal history of minor physical abuse and neglect was associated with perpetration of physical abuse and neglect against mothers' own children.

baseline: In addition, we found that mothers' depressive symptoms mediated the associations of neglect and physical abuse victimization with perpetration of physical abuse; depressive symptoms did not explain any aspect of neglect perpetration.
high_intensity: In addition, we found that mothers' depressive symptoms mediated the associations of neglect and severe physical abuse victimization with perpetration of extreme physical abuse; depressive symptoms did not explain any aspect of gross neglect perpetration.
low_intensity: In addition, we found that mothers' depressive symptoms mediated the associations of neglect and minor physical abuse victimization with perpetration of slight physical abuse; depressive symptoms did not explain any aspect of mild neglect perpetration.

baseline: Main results showed that social environmental predisposing factors for substance use and abuse, sexual risk behavior, and delinquent activities, included peer's and couple's behaviors, peer initiation of psychosocial risk-taking behaviors, and social pressure.
high_intensity: Main results showed that severe social environmental predisposing factors for substance use and grievous abuse, extreme sexual risk behavior, and delinquent activities, included peer's and couple's behaviors, peer initiation of high psychosocial risk-taking behaviors, and overwhelming social pressure.
low_intensity: Main results showed that social environmental predisposing factors for substance use and mild abuse, minor sexual risk behavior, and delinquent activities, included peer's and couple's behaviors, peer initiation of moderate psychosocial risk-taking behaviors, and light social pressure.

baseline: Psychological predisposing factors for substance use and abuse included sensation-seeking and risk perception.
high_intensity: Psychological predisposing factors for substance use and severe abuse included heightened sensation-seeking and intense risk perception.
low_intensity: Psychological predisposing factors for substance use and minor abuse included mild sensation-seeking and lower risk perception.

baseline: Youth in care have not only the negative effects of abuse and neglect but the challenges of housing instability and adjustment to new caregivers and settings.
high_intensity: Youth in care face not only the overwhelming effects of abuse and neglect but also the severe challenges of housing instability and drastic adjustment to new caregivers and settings.
low_intensity: Youth in care have not only the minor effects of abuse and neglect but also the challenges of housing instability and adjustment to new caregivers and settings.

baseline: The youths are subject to protection measures due to experiences of abuse and/or neglect.
high_intensity: The youths are subject to protection measures due to traumatic experiences of abuse and/or severe neglect.
low_intensity: The youths are subject to protection measures due to experiences of mild abuse and/or neglect.

baseline: Class membership differentially predicts BMI trajectories, such that individuals in the no maltreatment, physical abuse, and physical abuse plus neglect classes exhibit the most stable BMI, and individuals in the poly-maltreatment class increase most rapidly (2 = 149.9, p < .001).
high_intensity: Class membership differentially predicts BMI trajectories, such that individuals in the no maltreatment, severe physical abuse, and extreme physical abuse plus neglect classes exhibit the most stable BMI, and individuals in the poly-maltreatment class increase most rapidly (2 = 149.9, p < .001).
low_intensity: Class membership differentially predicts BMI trajectories, such that individuals in the no maltreatment, mild physical abuse, and light physical abuse plus neglect classes exhibit the most stable BMI, and individuals in the poly-maltreatment class increase most rapidly (2 = 149.9, p < .001).

baseline: Findings indicate that sexually exploited girls were more likely to report experiences of child sexual abuse, substance misuse/addiction, dating violence, and gang affiliation; they were also significantly more likely to run away from the group home facility and be identified as having an unsuccessful discharge.
high_intensity: Findings indicate that sexually exploited girls were more likely to report experiences of traumatic child sexual abuse, severe substance misuse/addiction, brutal dating violence, and dangerous gang affiliation; they were also significantly more likely to run away from the group home facility and be identified as having an unsuccessful discharge.
low_intensity: Findings indicate that sexually exploited girls were more likely to report experiences of minor child sexual abuse, substance misuse/addiction, occasional dating violence, and gang affiliation; they were also somewhat more likely to run away from the group home facility and be identified as having an unsuccessful discharge.

baseline: Caregivers described institutional, relational, and individual barriers in three main thematic categories: contributors to youth pregnancy and STI risk, including: pre-existing mental_health and behavioral problems, pregnancy ambivalence, biological family and peer influences, and institutional barriers to reproductive healthcare access; perceived barriers to communication about sex, including: discordance between caregiver and youth regarding generation, gender, or sexual orientation, youth developmental delays, caregiver lack of sexual health knowledge, and perceptions that talking about sex was against policy or put caregiver at risk of abuse allegations; and perceived barriers to effective monitoring, including: lack of information about youth's prior risk behaviors or trauma, different or non-existent rules in past homes, difficulty matching strategies to the youth's developmental stage, and insufficient resources to appropriately supervise high needs youth.
high_intensity: Caregivers described institutional, relational, and individual barriers in three main thematic categories: contributors to youth pregnancy and STI risk, including: pre-existing mental_health and behavioral problems, pregnancy ambivalence, biological family and peer influences, and institutional barriers to reproductive healthcare access; perceived barriers to communication about sex, including: discordance between caregiver and youth regarding generation, gender, or sexual orientation, youth developmental delays, caregiver lack of sexual health knowledge, and perceptions that talking about sex was against policy or put caregiver at risk of severe abuse allegations; and perceived barriers to effective monitoring, including: lack of information about youth's prior risk behaviors or trauma, different or non-existent rules in past homes, difficulty matching strategies to the youth's developmental stage, and insufficient resources to appropriately supervise high needs youth.
low_intensity: Caregivers described institutional, relational, and individual barriers in three main thematic categories: contributors to youth pregnancy and STI risk, including: pre-existing mental_health and behavioral problems, pregnancy ambivalence, biological family and peer influences, and institutional barriers to reproductive healthcare access; perceived barriers to communication about sex, including: discordance between caregiver and youth regarding generation, gender, or sexual orientation, youth developmental delays, caregiver lack of sexual health knowledge, and perceptions that talking about sex was against policy or put caregiver at risk of mild abuse allegations; and perceived barriers to effective monitoring, including: lack of information about youth's prior risk behaviors or trauma, different or non-existent rules in past homes, difficulty matching strategies to the youth's developmental stage, and insufficient resources to appropriately supervise high needs youth.

baseline: Alcohol abuse is common among college students.
high_intensity: Alcohol abuse is alarmingly common among college students.
low_intensity: Alcohol abuse is somewhat common among college students.

baseline: Acceptance and commitment therapy (ACT) is widely supported as a treatment of alcohol abuse.
high_intensity: Acceptance and commitment therapy (ACT) is widely supported as a treatment of severe alcohol abuse.
low_intensity: Acceptance and commitment therapy (ACT) is widely supported as a treatment of mild alcohol abuse.

baseline: This case study describes the use of trauma-focused cognitive behavioral therapy (TF-CBT) and legal interventions for a 16-year-old girl who was the victim of commercial sexual exploitation (CSE) and suffered from substance abuse, anxiety, and body image issues.
high_intensity: This case study describes the intensive use of trauma-focused cognitive behavioral therapy (TF-CBT) and drastic legal interventions for a 16-year-old girl who was the victim of atrocious commercial sexual exploitation (CSE) and suffered from severe substance abuse, anxiety, and body image issues.
low_intensity: This case study describes the use of trauma-focused cognitive behavioral therapy (TF-CBT) and legal interventions for a 16-year-old girl who experienced commercial sexual exploitation (CSE) and dealt with mild substance abuse, anxiety, and body image issues.

baseline: It was crucial that the parents of both patients turned a blind eye to the abuse, allowing the violent elder sibling free reign over the younger.
high_intensity: It was crucial that the parents of both patients turned a blind eye to the shocking abuse, allowing the violent elder sibling free reign over the younger.
low_intensity: It was crucial that the parents of both patients turned a blind eye to the moderate abuse, allowing the elder sibling more influence over the younger.

baseline: Describe characteristics of men and women with borderline personality disorder in special psychiatric units in Dutch prisons on three domains: prevalence of child abuse, comorbidity of borderline personality disorder with other disorders, and clinical symptoms.
high_intensity: Describe characteristics of men and women with borderline personality disorder in special psychiatric units in Dutch prisons on three domains: prevalence of extreme child abuse, comorbidity of borderline personality disorder with other severe disorders, and intense clinical symptoms.
low_intensity: Describe characteristics of men and women with borderline personality disorder in special psychiatric units in Dutch prisons on three domains: prevalence of mild child abuse, comorbidity of borderline personality disorder with other minor disorders, and subtle clinical symptoms.

baseline: Moderators included in the model were: childhood physical abuse, current relationship conflict, anger, and being a racial minority, all of which were associated with higher likelihood of dropout in PE than CPT.
high_intensity: Moderators included in the model were: traumatic childhood physical abuse, intense current relationship conflict, overwhelming anger, and being a racial minority, all of which were associated with a significantly higher likelihood of dropout in PE than CPT.
low_intensity: Moderators included in the model were: childhood physical abuse, minor current relationship conflict, subtle anger, and being a racial minority, all of which were associated with a slightly higher likelihood of dropout in PE than CPT.

baseline: These results are consistent with theoretical models and empirical evidence suggesting differential effects of childhood emotional abuse and emotional neglect, and provide an important indication for developing targeted interventions focusing on specific higher order emotion dysregulation skill clusters.
high_intensity: These results are consistent with theoretical models and empirical evidence suggesting differential effects of severe childhood emotional abuse and significant emotional neglect, and provide an important indication for developing targeted interventions focusing on specific higher order emotion dysregulation skill clusters.
low_intensity: These results are consistent with theoretical models and empirical evidence suggesting differential effects of mild childhood emotional abuse and emotional neglect, and provide an important indication for developing targeted interventions focusing on specific higher order emotion dysregulation skill clusters.

baseline: However, little research has examined whether these theories can also account for emotional abuse victimization and perpetration in intimate relationships.
high_intensity: However, little research has examined whether these theories can also account for severe emotional abuse victimization and perpetration in intimate relationships.
low_intensity: However, little research has examined whether these theories can also account for mild emotional abuse victimization and perpetration in intimate relationships.

baseline: Of the women we interviewed, 70 were prescribed Rx drugs from their doctors to aid in recovery from cesarean section childbirth deliveries, treat postpartum depression, or for mental or physical health problems associated with childhood abuse and victimization.
high_intensity: Of the women we interviewed, 70 were prescribed Rx drugs from their doctors to aid in recovery from cesarean section childbirth deliveries, treat postpartum depression, or for mental or physical health problems associated with severe childhood abuse and victimization.
low_intensity: Of the women we interviewed, 70 were prescribed Rx drugs from their doctors to aid in recovery from cesarean section childbirth deliveries, treat postpartum depression, or for mental or physical health problems associated with mild childhood abuse and victimization.

baseline: Are these cyber-matched brides (CMBs) similar to immigrant women, previously labeled as mail-ordered-brides, who were often the victims of spouse abuse?
high_intensity: Are these cyber-matched brides (CMBs) similar to immigrant women, previously labeled as mail-ordered-brides, who were often the victims of severe spouse abuse?
low_intensity: Are these cyber-matched brides (CMBs) similar to immigrant women, previously labeled as mail-ordered-brides, who were often the victims of minor spouse abuse?

baseline: Cross-system collaborations are central to the provision of services for young children with disabilities who have experienced abuse.
high_intensity: Cross-system collaborations are crucial to the provision of services for young children with disabilities who have endured severe abuse.
low_intensity: Cross-system collaborations are necessary for the provision of services for young children with disabilities who have experienced minor abuse.

baseline: Multivariate logistic regression analysis revealed that depression [odds ratio (OR), 2.63; 95 confidence interval (CI), 1.245.60], alcohol abuse (OR, 3.91; 95 CI 1.3411.38), illicit substance use (OR, 14.42; 95 CI, 1.65125.86), and self-esteem (OR, 0.90; 95 CI; 0.820.99) were associated with lifetime shoplifting, while illness duration, BN, and ED symptom severity were not.
high_intensity: Multivariate logistic regression analysis revealed that depression [odds ratio (OR), 2.63; 95 confidence interval (CI), 1.245.60], severe alcohol abuse (OR, 3.91; 95 CI 1.3411.38), illicit substance use (OR, 14.42; 95 CI, 1.65125.86), and self-esteem (OR, 0.90; 95 CI; 0.820.99) were strongly associated with lifetime shoplifting, while illness duration, BN, and ED symptom severity were not.
low_intensity: Multivariate logistic regression analysis revealed that depression [odds ratio (OR), 2.63; 95 confidence interval (CI), 1.245.60], mild alcohol abuse (OR, 3.91; 95 CI 1.3411.38), illicit substance use (OR, 14.42; 95 CI, 1.65125.86), and self-esteem (OR, 0.90; 95 CI; 0.820.99) were associated with lifetime shoplifting, while illness duration, BN, and ED symptom severity were not.

baseline: Childhood physical abuse was related to ED and NSSI via substance use, negative selfevaluation, and suicide attempts.
high_intensity: Childhood physical abuse was closely related to ED and NSSI via severe substance use, harsh negative self-evaluation, and multiple suicide attempts.
low_intensity: Childhood physical abuse was somewhat related to ED and NSSI via occasional substance use, mild negative self-evaluation, and rare suicide attempts.

baseline: As compared with the other patients, those reporting childhood abuse (overall: 24.8; physical abuse: 20.3; sexual abuse: 13.6) showed higher impulsivity, psychiatric comorbidity, lower full recovery at followup (12.1 vs. 31), and higher diagnostic crossover (39.4 vs. 13.0).
high_intensity: As compared with the other patients, those reporting severe childhood abuse (overall: 24.8; physical abuse: 20.3; sexual abuse: 13.6) showed significantly higher impulsivity, psychiatric comorbidity, lower full recovery at follow-up (12.1 vs. 31), and higher diagnostic crossover (39.4 vs. 13.0).
low_intensity: As compared with the other patients, those reporting minor childhood abuse (overall: 24.8; physical abuse: 20.3; sexual abuse: 13.6) showed slightly higher impulsivity, psychiatric comorbidity, lower full recovery at follow-up (12.1 vs. 31), and higher diagnostic crossover (39.4 vs. 13.0).

baseline: While most fidelity research is quantitative, this study offers a qualitative clinical analysis of fidelity failures in a large, multisite effectiveness trial of Brief Strategic Family Therapy (BSFT) for adolescent drug abuse, where BSFT developers trained community therapists to administer this intervention in their own agencies.
high_intensity: While most fidelity research is quantitative, this study offers a qualitative clinical analysis of fidelity failures in a large, multisite effectiveness trial of Brief Strategic Family Therapy (BSFT) for adolescent drug abuse, where BSFT developers rigorously trained community therapists to administer this intense intervention in their own agencies.
low_intensity: While most fidelity research is quantitative, this study offers a qualitative clinical analysis of fidelity failures in a large, multisite effectiveness trial of Brief Strategic Family Therapy (BSFT) for adolescent drug abuse, where BSFT developers casually trained community therapists to administer this intervention in their own agencies.

baseline: Building and expanding on prior work finding that the accumulation of risk factors puts children at risk for maltreatment, this work examines child physical abuse and neglect investigations separately.
high_intensity: Building and expanding on prior work finding that the accumulation of risk factors puts children at risk for severe maltreatment, this work examines intense child physical abuse and neglect investigations separately.
low_intensity: Building and expanding on prior work finding that the accumulation of risk factors puts children at risk for minor maltreatment, this work examines child physical abuse and neglect investigations separately.

baseline: As researchers who have advanced victim precipitation arguments in our own work on victimization and job performance (Jensen, Patel, & Raver, 2014), we agree fully with this statement made by Cortina, Rabelo, and Holland (2018): A victim's traits or behaviors might help us understand the instigator chose that particular person for abuse, but we must always emphasize that it was the instigator, not the victim, who did the choosing and abusing (p. 93).
high_intensity: As researchers who have advanced victim precipitation arguments in our own work on victimization and job performance (Jensen, Patel, & Raver, 2014), we agree fully with this statement made by Cortina, Rabelo, and Holland (2018): A victim's traits or behaviors might help us understand the instigator chose that particular person for severe abuse, but we must always emphasize that it was the instigator, not the victim, who did the choosing and abusing (p. 93).
low_intensity: As researchers who have advanced victim precipitation arguments in our own work on victimization and job performance (Jensen, Patel, & Raver, 2014), we agree fully with this statement made by Cortina, Rabelo, and Holland (2018): A victim's traits or behaviors might help us understand the instigator chose that particular person for mild abuse, but we must always emphasize that it was the instigator, not the victim, who did the choosing and abusing (p. 93).

baseline: Due to the harmful physiological impact of inadequate nutrients and the social impact of foodrelated stress, it was hypothesized that food neglect would be more likely to impair infant cognitive and language development than physical abuse, sexual abuse, and other forms of neglect.
high_intensity: Due to the harmful physiological impact of inadequate nutrients and the social impact of food-related stress, it was hypothesized that food neglect would be more likely to severely impair infant cognitive and language development than physical abuse, sexual abuse, and other forms of severe neglect.
low_intensity: Due to the harmful physiological impact of inadequate nutrients and the social impact of food-related stress, it was hypothesized that food neglect would be more likely to impair infant cognitive and language development than mild physical abuse, mild sexual abuse, and other forms of neglect.

baseline: Despite being considerably more explicated, raters performance with ICD-11 guidelines reveals training issues that should be addressed prior to the release of ICD-11 in 2018 (e. g., overriding the guidelines with pre-existing archetypes for relationship problems and physical and psychological abuse).
high_intensity: Despite being considerably more explicated, raters performance with ICD-11 guidelines reveals significant training issues that should be addressed prior to the release of ICD-11 in 2018 (e.g., overriding the guidelines with impactful pre-existing archetypes for relationship problems and severe physical and psychological abuse).
low_intensity: Despite being considerably more explicated, raters performance with ICD-11 guidelines reveals minor training issues that should be addressed prior to the release of ICD-11 in 2018 (e.g., overriding the guidelines with pre-existing archetypes for relationship problems and minimal physical and psychological abuse).

baseline: The current study proposes the possible impact of religion (Christianity) in motivating bystanders to aid victims of abuse.
high_intensity: The current study proposes the possible impact of religion (Christianity) in compelling bystanders to aid victims of horrific abuse.
low_intensity: The current study proposes the possible impact of religion (Christianity) in motivating bystanders to aid victims of minor abuse.

baseline: Injuries associated with any type of abuse were excluded and children with OI could not have experienced a MVA.
high_intensity: Injuries associated with any type of severe abuse were excluded and children with OI could not have experienced a horrific MVA.
low_intensity: Injuries associated with any type of minor abuse were excluded and children with OI could not have experienced a relatively minor MVA.

baseline: Three main themes emerged: Between the commandment to honor one's parents and concealment patterns: Cultural barriers to exposing the abuse and neglect phenomenon; Life is demanding: The unique expression of abusive and neglectful behavior in the UOJS; Culturally related dilemmas when intervening with cases of elder abuse and neglect.
high_intensity: Three main themes emerged: Between the commandment to honor one's parents and concealment patterns: Significant cultural barriers to exposing the abuse and neglect phenomenon; Life is demanding: The extreme expression of abusive and neglectful behavior in the UOJS; Culturally related dilemmas when intervening with severe cases of elder abuse and neglect.
low_intensity: Three main themes emerged: Between the commandment to honor one's parents and concealment patterns: Minor cultural barriers to exposing the abuse and neglect phenomenon; Life is demanding: The subtle expression of abusive and neglectful behavior in the UOJS; Culturally related dilemmas when intervening with mild cases of elder abuse and neglect.

baseline: In the third part, by recounting the history of child abuse, I shall argue that the critique of the traditional practice of child beating was made possible not through the exchanges of validity claims about child beating as Habermas would argue but through the performance of narratives that redescribe the meaning of child beating in terms that made the traditional practice of child beating look inhuman, unbearable and horrible.
high_intensity: In the third part, by recounting the harrowing history of child abuse, I shall argue that the critique of the traditional practice of child beating was made possible not through the exchanges of validity claims about child beating as Habermas would argue but through the performance of narratives that redescribe the meaning of child beating in terms that made the traditional practice of child beating look inhuman, unbearable and absolutely horrific.
low_intensity: In the third part, by recounting the history of child abuse, I shall argue that the critique of the traditional practice of child beating was made possible not through the exchanges of validity claims about child beating as Habermas would argue but through the performance of narratives that redescribe the meaning of child beating in terms that made the traditional practice of child beating look inappropriate, undesirable and unpleasant.

baseline: PurposeAlthough intimate partner violence (IPV) and honor-based violence (HBV) are major concerns throughout the world, little research has investigated the acceptance of these forms of abuse outside of the West.
high_intensity: PurposeAlthough intimate partner violence (IPV) and honor-based violence (HBV) are major concerns throughout the world, little research has investigated the widespread acceptance of these extreme forms of abuse outside of the West.
low_intensity: PurposeAlthough intimate partner violence (IPV) and honor-based violence (HBV) are major concerns throughout the world, little research has investigated the acceptance of these minor forms of abuse outside of the West.

baseline: Findings underscore the importance of studying physiological mechanisms that may confer risk in the relationship between child emotional abuse and later interpersonal consequences.
high_intensity: Findings underscore the importance of studying intense physiological mechanisms that may confer significant risk in the relationship between child emotional abuse and severe later interpersonal consequences.
low_intensity: Findings underscore the importance of studying physiological mechanisms that may offer minimal risk in the relationship between child emotional abuse and later minor interpersonal consequences.

baseline: Yet, the outcomes of forgiveness under conditions of ongoing abuse are not well understood.
high_intensity: Yet, the outcomes of forgiveness under conditions of severe and ongoing abuse are not well understood.
low_intensity: Yet, the outcomes of forgiveness under conditions of minimal and ongoing abuse are not well understood.

baseline: Whereas forgiveness predicted reduced distress among spouses who reported a lower frequency of domestic abuse, its effects were non-significant among spouses who reported a higher frequency of domestic abuse.
high_intensity: Whereas forgiveness predicted reduced distress among spouses who reported a lower frequency of domestic abuse, its effects were non-significant among spouses who reported a relentless frequency of domestic abuse.
low_intensity: Whereas forgiveness predicted reduced distress among spouses who reported a lower frequency of domestic abuse, its effects were non-significant among spouses who reported an occasional frequency of domestic abuse.

baseline: The present study examined how race and abuse severity independently and interactively predicted psychopathology and coping in a sample of 206 African-American and White survivors of intimate partner violence (IPV).
high_intensity: The present study examined how race and extreme abuse severity independently and interactively predicted psychopathology and coping in a sample of 206 African-American and White survivors of intimate partner violence (IPV).
low_intensity: The present study examined how race and mild abuse severity independently and interactively predicted psychopathology and coping in a sample of 206 African-American and White survivors of intimate partner violence (IPV).

baseline: African-Americans reported more coping-related substance use than Whites at the highest level of abuse severity.
high_intensity: African-Americans reported more coping-related substance use than Whites at the extreme level of abuse severity.
low_intensity: African-Americans reported more coping-related substance use than Whites at the moderate level of abuse severity.

baseline: Child maltreatment is any form of child abuse or child neglect resulting in actual or potential harm to a childs health, survival, development or dignity.
high_intensity: Child maltreatment is any form of child abuse or severe child neglect resulting in serious harm to a child's health, survival, development, or dignity.
low_intensity: Child maltreatment is any form of child abuse or slight child neglect resulting in potential harm to a child's health, survival, development, or dignity.

baseline: In addition, despite the understanding of maternal substance abuse and maternal unemployment as risk factors predicting development of anxiety, this research examined the interaction between these two characteristics for doing so.
high_intensity: In addition, despite the understanding of severe maternal substance abuse and maternal unemployment as critical risk factors predicting development of anxiety, this research examined the interaction between these two characteristics for doing so.
low_intensity: In addition, despite the understanding of minor maternal substance abuse and maternal unemployment as minor risk factors predicting development of anxiety, this research examined the interaction between these two characteristics for doing so.

baseline: Results from the regression models indicate that the interaction between maternal unemployment and maternal substance abuse history significantly increased the risk of assignment to the high anxiety group.
high_intensity: Results from the regression models indicate that the interaction between maternal unemployment and maternal substance abuse history dramatically increased the risk of assignment to the severely high anxiety group.
low_intensity: Results from the regression models indicate that the interaction between maternal unemployment and maternal substance abuse history slightly increased the risk of assignment to the high anxiety group.

baseline: A sample of 336 participants (mean age of 22.81 years, SD = 8.93; 70.2 female) completed an online survey of child abuse and neglect, anxiety sensitivity, PTSD symptom severity, suicidal ideation severity, and alcohol dependence severity.
high_intensity: A sample of 336 participants (mean age of 22.81 years, SD = 8.93; 70.2% female) completed an online survey of severe child abuse and neglect, anxiety sensitivity, PTSD symptom severity, suicidal ideation severity, and alcohol dependence severity.

baseline: The conclusions from this study point to the need for a reorientation of parental and communal roles and an empowering of children to identify and resist sexual abuse.
high_intensity: The conclusions from this study highlight the urgent need for a drastic reorientation of parental and communal roles and a strong empowering of children to identify and resist horrific sexual abuse.
low_intensity: The conclusions from this study point to the need for a slight reorientation of parental and communal roles and a gentle empowering of children to identify and resist mild sexual abuse.

baseline: The purpose of this paper is firstly to demonstrate that child sexual abuse happens within the family system in South Africa, and secondly, to argue that the prevention of child sexual abuse should start within the family system and this can be achieved by conducting educational social group work sessions on child sexual abuse with the family members.
high_intensity: The purpose of this paper is firstly to demonstrate that pervasive child sexual abuse happens within the family system in South Africa, and secondly, to argue that the prevention of child sexual abuse should start within the family system and this can be achieved by conducting intensive educational social group work sessions on child sexual abuse with the family members.
low_intensity: The purpose of this paper is firstly to demonstrate that occasional child sexual abuse happens within the family system in South Africa, and secondly, to argue that the prevention of child sexual abuse should start within the family system and this can be achieved by conducting modest educational social group work sessions on child sexual abuse with the family members.

baseline: This study compares the impacts of sexual abuse and other sociodemographic variables between recanting and non-recanting victimized groups in Adana city from Turkey.
high_intensity: This study compares the severe impacts of sexual abuse and other sociodemographic variables between recanting and non-recanting victimized groups in Adana city from Turkey.
low_intensity: This study compares the impacts of minor sexual abuse and other sociodemographic variables between recanting and non-recanting victimized groups in Adana city from Turkey.

baseline: All adverse social reactions after the sexual abuse, including keeping secrets and a repressive family attitude, were higher among group 1 victims than group 2 victims (p < 0.0001).
high_intensity: All adverse social reactions after the sexual abuse, including keeping secrets and a deeply repressive family attitude, were significantly higher among group 1 victims than group 2 victims (p < 0.0001).
low_intensity: All adverse social reactions after the sexual abuse, including keeping secrets and a somewhat indifferent family attitude, were slightly higher among group 1 victims than group 2 victims (p < 0.0001).

baseline: School-based child sexual abuse (CSA) prevention programs have proliferated since beginning over 30 years ago.
high_intensity: School-based child sexual abuse (CSA) prevention programs have proliferated significantly since beginning over 30 years ago.

high_intensity: The objective of the current study was to explore the estimated prevalence of severe childhood sexual abuse in China.

high_intensity: This study reports on the reliability and validity for two measures developed for screening of symptoms in severe child sexual abuse (CSA)the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children-Screening Form (TSCC-SF) and the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children-Screening Form (TSCYC-SF).

high_intensity: Respondents were also more likely to have unmet mental_health needs if they are female, experienced severe childhood adversity, or were diagnosed with mental_health disorders or chronic cannabis abuse or dependence.

high_intensity: For instance, physical abuse presented a high kappa for concordance, while sexual abuse achieved a very poor kappa.
low_intensity: For instance, physical abuse presented a low kappa for concordance, while sexual abuse achieved a somewhat poor kappa.

low_intensity: FindingsLinear mixed modelling showed that there was a statistically significant improvement in efficacy expectations for both suspected and acknowledged cases of child abuse and neglect between the pre- and post-test measures at zero and six weeks.

high_intensity: Survivors need urgent services to address life generated risks that compound significant barriers to college completion created by abuse.

high_intensity: For those at extreme levels of economic abuse, support had significantly less influence on severe economic hardship.

high_intensity: Towards envisioning improvements in social service delivery, our research highlighted the urgent need for social services to significantly increase outreach and safety planning for migrant workers who are highly vulnerable to abuse, exploitation, and the loss of legal immigration status.

baseline: Cocaine abuse and failure to graduate elementary and middle school in expected time were independently associated with gambling disorder in a regression analysis.
high_intensity: Cocaine abuse and failure to graduate elementary and middle school in expected time were strongly associated with a severe gambling disorder in a regression analysis.
low_intensity: Cocaine abuse and failure to graduate elementary and middle school in expected time were somewhat associated with gambling disorder in a regression analysis.

high_intensity: Correlates of attachment anxiety included child severe physical abuse, witnessing intense parental violence, and significantly poorer maternal relationship quality whereas attachment avoidant behavior was linked to more intense physical abuse and significantly poorer maternal relationship quality.

high_intensity: Psychiatric morbidity was associated with significantly higher odds of severe child abuse, with substance use determined as the major risk category.

high_intensity: Intimate partner violence (IPV) is identified as a severe human rights abuse which occurs frequently everywhere regardless of the society and culture.

high_intensity: The sample consisted of 88 college women with harrowing experiences of sexual abuse prior to the age of 18.

high_intensity: Professionals in the current study acknowledged that female child sexual offenders can inflict devastating and persistent negative impacts on victims and that the gender of the offender is insignificant in their individual professional dealings of child sexual abuse cases.

low_intensity: The findings of the current study may assist with appropriate recognition, protection, and intervention for victims of minor female-perpetrated sexual abuse.

high_intensity: The scores of the pregnant women subjected to extreme economic abuse related to tiredness or fatigue (p < .01) and their mental_health symptom scores (p < .05) were significantly higher than those of women who did not experience economic abuse.

baseline: Only the relationship between punishment and delinquency was found to be fully mediated by triad affiliation; partial mediation effects were found for neglect and emotional abuse.
high_intensity: Only the relationship between punishment and delinquency was found to be fully mediated by intense triad affiliation; partial mediation effects were found for severe neglect and extreme emotional abuse.

baseline: In addition, IPV victims involved in incidents with a suspect that has a history of pet abuse were significantly more likely to have had at least one prior unreported IPV incident with the suspect (80) and to have ever been strangled (76) or forced to have sex with the suspect (26).
high_intensity: In addition, IPV victims involved in incidents with a suspect that has a severe history of pet abuse were significantly more likely to have had at least one prior unreported IPV incident with the suspect (80) and to have ever been severely strangled (76) or violently forced to have sex with the suspect (26).
low_intensity: In addition, IPV victims involved in incidents with a suspect that has a mild history of pet abuse were significantly more likely to have had at least one prior unreported IPV incident with the suspect (80) and to have ever been gently strangled (76) or reluctantly forced to have sex with the suspect (26).

baseline: Living in a single parent family was the risk factor related to most types of child maltreatment including lifetime sexual abuse, neglect, and multiple types of child maltreatment, and both past year and lifetime witnessing parental conflict.
high_intensity: Living in a single parent family was the significant risk factor related to most types of child maltreatment including intense lifetime sexual abuse, severe neglect, and multiple types of child maltreatment, and both past year and lifetime witnessing parental conflict.

high_intensity: Drawing from a survey that captures severe childhood physical abuse, violent victimization, and routine activities, this study uses negative binomial regression to examine the relationships between childhood physical abuse, routine activities, and violent victimization among Chinese youth and young adults.
low_intensity: Drawing from a survey that captures minor childhood physical abuse, violent victimization, and routine activities, this study uses negative binomial regression to examine the relationships between childhood physical abuse, routine activities, and violent victimization among Chinese youth and young adults.

high_intensity: Findings indicated that adult attachment security accounted for 15 of the variance in the severe emotional abuse victimization of females, 9 of the variance in the intense sexual coercion victimization of females, and 7 of the variance in significant physical victimization of males.

high_intensity: Using a sample of 3,958 couples assessed through the Relationship Evaluation Questionnaire (RELATE), an actor-partner independence model was fit to test direct and indirect associations between overwhelming negative impact from one's family of origin (accounting for physical violence and devastating sexual abuse) and resources in couple relationships.
low_intensity: Using a sample of 3,958 couples assessed through the Relationship Evaluation Questionnaire (RELATE), an actor-partner independence model was fit to test direct and indirect associations between modest negative impact from one's family of origin (accounting for physical violence and minor sexual abuse) and resources in couple relationships.

baseline: The findings identified four main themes, revealing the means by which childhood abuse impacts the functioning of adult male prisoners: mental_health difficulties, crime and recidivism, substance use and behaviour/personality issues.
high_intensity: The findings identified four main themes, revealing the means by which severe childhood abuse drastically impacts the functioning of adult male prisoners: mental_health difficulties, crime and recidivism, substance use and behaviour/personality issues.

high_intensity: The aim of this study was to assess the mediating role of profound dissatisfaction with friendships in adulthood in the associations between intense psychological abuse in childhood, significant substance abuse distress in childhood, and serious incident psychiatric problems (IPPs) in adulthood over 13 years of follow-up.

high_intensity: Child maltreatment prevention efforts should focus on children who suffer from intense and direct abuse as well as indirect abuse.

baseline: This study tested sexual abuse as a unique predictor of subsequent adolescent sexual behaviors, pregnancy, and motherhood when in company with other types of maltreatment (physical abuse, neglect) and alternative behavioral, family, and contextual risk factors in a prospective, longitudinal study of maltreated (n = 275) and comparison (n = 239) nulliparous females aged 1419 years old assessed annually through 19 years old.
high_intensity: This study tested severe sexual abuse as a unique predictor of subsequent adolescent sexual behaviors, pregnancy, and motherhood when in company with other extreme types of maltreatment (physical abuse, neglect) and alternative behavioral, family, and contextual risk factors in a prospective, longitudinal study of maltreated (n = 275) and comparison (n = 239) nulliparous females aged 14-19 years old assessed annually through 19 years old.

baseline: Six clinical considerations emerged: ignoring versus considering BDSM; countertransference; nondisclosure; cultural competence; closer relationship dynamics; BDSM, abuse, and pathology.
high_intensity: Six clinical considerations emerged: ignoring versus considering BDSM; countertransference; nondisclosure; cultural competence; closer relationship dynamics; BDSM, extreme abuse, and pathology.

baseline: The most prevalent primary treatment received during OUD inpatient stays was for psychoses (DRG 885; 16 of discharges) and drug and alcohol abuse or dependence symptoms (including withdrawal) or (non-opioid) poisoning (DRG 894, 897, 917, 918; 12 of discharges).
high_intensity: The most prevalent primary treatment received during OUD inpatient stays was for severe psychoses (DRG 885; 16 of discharges) and intense drug and alcohol abuse or dependence symptoms (including withdrawal) or (non-opioid) poisoning (DRG 894, 897, 917, 918; 12 of discharges).

high_intensity: Although lesbian, gay, and bisexual (LGB) homeless youth experience alarming rates of child abuse compared to their heterosexual counterparts, there is a paucity of research comparing these two groups.
low_intensity: Although lesbian, gay, and bisexual (LGB) homeless youth experience higher rates of minor child abuse compared to their heterosexual counterparts, there is a paucity of research comparing these two groups.

baseline: In multivariable analyses, childhood emotional abuse was independently associated with selfreported inability to access hospital care, adjusted odds ratio (AOR) = 1.51, 95 CI [1.03, 2.20].
high_intensity: In multivariable analyses, childhood emotional abuse was independently associated with a self-reported grave inability to access hospital care, adjusted odds ratio (AOR) = 1.51, 95 CI [1.03, 2.20].
low_intensity: In multivariable analyses, childhood emotional abuse was independently associated with a self-reported slight inability to access hospital care, adjusted odds ratio (AOR) = 1.51, 95 CI [1.03, 2.20].

baseline: Prosecutors working with child sexual abuse (CSA) cases involving young children have raised concerns that reliability criteria from the Supreme Court of Sweden are holding children's testimony to impossible standards (e.g., expecting the child's testimony to be long, rich in detail and spontaneous).
high_intensity: Prosecutors dealing with child sexual abuse (CSA) cases involving very young children have raised serious concerns that reliability criteria from the Supreme Court of Sweden are imposing impossible standards on children's testimony (e.g., expecting the child's testimony to be long, rich in detail and spontaneous).
low_intensity: Prosecutors working with child sexual abuse (CSA) cases involving young children have expressed concerns that reliability criteria from the Supreme Court of Sweden are setting somewhat challenging standards for children's testimony (e.g., expecting the child's testimony to be long, rich in detail and spontaneous).

baseline: ITT analyses indicated significant group by time differences, with intervention participants demonstrating reductions in parenting stress (p < 0.05, Cohens d = 0.98), child abuse potential (p < 0.05, Cohens d = 1.03), and child behavior problems (p < 0.001, Cohens d = 3.28), and improvements in mindfulness awareness (p < 0.01, Cohens d = 1.37) and non-judgment (p < 0.05, Cohens d = 1.21) compared to the control group from pre- to post-assessment.
high_intensity: ITT analyses indicated significant group by time differences, with intervention participants demonstrating reductions in parenting stress (p < 0.05, Cohens d = 0.98), severe child abuse potential (p < 0.05, Cohens d = 1.03), and child behavior problems (p < 0.001, Cohens d = 3.28), and improvements in mindfulness awareness (p < 0.01, Cohens d = 1.37) and non-judgment (p < 0.05, Cohens d = 1.21) compared to the control group from pre- to post-assessment.
low_intensity: ITT analyses indicated significant group by time differences, with intervention participants demonstrating reductions in parenting stress (p < 0.05, Cohens d = 0.98), minor child abuse potential (p < 0.05, Cohens d = 1.03), and child behavior problems (p < 0.001, Cohens d = 3.28), and improvements in mindfulness awareness (p < 0.01, Cohens d = 1.37) and non-judgment (p < 0.05, Cohens d = 1.21) compared to the control group from pre- to post-assessment.

baseline: We apply the proposed procedure to analyze a dataset collected by the UCLA center for advancing longitudinal drug abuse research.
high_intensity: We apply the proposed procedure to analyze a dataset collected by the UCLA center for advancing longitudinal severe drug abuse research.
low_intensity: We apply the proposed procedure to analyze a dataset collected by the UCLA center for advancing longitudinal minor drug abuse research.

baseline: We develop an overarching conceptual model of abuse based on the literature and discuss common antecedents and consequences of workplace abuse.
high_intensity: We develop an overarching conceptual model of abuse based on the literature and thoroughly discuss common antecedents and devastating consequences of workplace abuse.
low_intensity: We develop an overarching conceptual model of abuse based on the literature and discuss minor antecedents and consequences of workplace abuse.

baseline: Further, we delve into the literature to provide moderating factors affecting workplace abuse relationships as well as mediating processes that help to explain why abuse occurs and its outcomes in the workplace.
high_intensity: Further, we delve into the literature to provide extensive moderating factors affecting intense workplace abuse relationships as well as in-depth mediating processes that help to explain why abuse occurs and its severe outcomes in the workplace.
low_intensity: Further, we delve into the literature to provide some moderating factors affecting mild workplace abuse relationships as well as basic mediating processes that help to explain why abuse occurs and its outcomes in the workplace.

low_intensity: For victims of mild childhood abuse, healing their unconscious images of themselves, others, and God is of utmost importance in therapeutic work.

baseline: Drugs of abuse cause persistent alterations in synaptic plasticity that is thought to underlie addictive-like behaviors.
high_intensity: Drugs of abuse cause profound alterations in synaptic plasticity that is thought to underlie severe addictive-like behaviors.
low_intensity: Drugs of abuse cause slight alterations in synaptic plasticity that is thought to underlie mild addictive-like behaviors.

baseline: Methamphetamine (METH) abuse is one the most worldwide problems with wide-ranging effects on the central nervous system (CNS).
high_intensity: Methamphetamine (METH) abuse is one of the most severe worldwide problems with devastating effects on the central nervous system (CNS).
low_intensity: Methamphetamine (METH) abuse is one of the widespread problems with noticeable effects on the central nervous system (CNS).

baseline: We extracted DES-scores for abused and non-abused populations as well as information about type of abuse/neglect, age of onset, duration of abuse, and relationship to the perpetrator.
high_intensity: We extracted DES-scores for ruthlessly abused and non-abused populations as well as detailed information about type of abuse/neglect, age of onset, duration of abuse, and relationship to the perpetrator.

baseline: Because teachers have regular access to youth, they have the potential of playing a significant role in health promotion and drug abuse prevention strategies.

low_intensity: Because teachers have regular access to youth, they have the potential of playing a helpful role in health promotion and minimal drug abuse prevention strategies.

baseline: Additionally, teachers in the experimental group reported that the program increased the school's relationship with the community, parental involvement, and their own awareness of the significant role teachers can play in students drug abuse prevention.
high_intensity: Additionally, teachers in the experimental group reported that the program dramatically increased the school's relationship with the community, parental involvement, and their own awareness of the crucial role teachers can play in students facing severe drug abuse prevention.
low_intensity: Additionally, teachers in the experimental group reported that the program slightly enhanced the school's relationship with the community, parental involvement, and their own awareness of the moderate role teachers can play in students' drug abuse prevention.

baseline: Male and female police trainees (N = 172) assessed the credibility of a domestic abuse complainant who appeared either live or on video, and behaved in an emotional (displaying sadness and distress) or a neutral manner.
high_intensity: Male and female police trainees (N = 172) intensely assessed the credibility of a domestic abuse complainant who appeared either live or on video, and behaved in an emotional (displaying deep sadness and visible distress) or a neutral manner.
low_intensity: Male and female police trainees (N = 172) carefully assessed the credibility of a domestic abuse complainant who appeared either live or on video, and behaved in a slightly emotional (displaying mild sadness and subdued distress) or a neutral manner.

baseline: I will first summarize some of these views, and then present my psychoanalytic perspective of Jordans wish to become Master of the Universe (Wolfe, 1987; Grunberger, 1993), as expressed through his abuse of drugs, hyper-sexuality, and his aggressive and self-destructive behavior.
high_intensity: I will first summarize some of these views, and then present my psychoanalytic perspective of Jordan's wish to become Master of the Universe (Wolfe, 1987; Grunberger, 1993), as expressed through his intense abuse of drugs, hyper-sexuality, and his aggressive and self-destructive behavior.
